characters: HE SPOTS A DEFIBRILLATOR, REACHES AND SWITCHES IT ON. LOW
A SIREN WAILS. LIGHTS FLOOD THE INSIDE AND OUTSIDE OF THE
BLEW AND A WEEK AFTER THAT, THIS 19-
I'M INCLINED TO TRY THIS PART -
MARSHALL STRUGGLES TO REGAIN CONTROL OF THE 747. HE OVER-
TNT. AIR FORCE ONE FLIGHT DECK
AND SLINKS AWAY WITH THE BOTTLE. MARSHALL CATCHES HIMSELF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen combat-ready special forces, wearing assault bla jump packs and combat gear, stare down the deep end of a  greasy ramp into the night sky.  Village lights flicker 1 feet below. The STRIKE FORCE LEADER signals to his team. Without a moment's hesitation, they dive into the darknes and plummet toward earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A military GUARD, old Soviet-style uniform, rounds the co of the large estate toting an AK-47. A red laser dot appears briefly on his forehead and, afte beat, the red dot seems to bleed.  The Guard collapses de Two other GUARDS are dispatched with single, silenced sho A Strike Team member at a junction box awaits a signal. Through infra-red binoculars the strike Force Leader watc his assault troops as they take positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into headset/in  Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the estate - as the power goes out.  The team on the  mansion's front porch pops the door and pours in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOWING - the FIVE TEAM MEMBERS as they rush a stairway phalanx formation.  They nearly knock over an old lady, w in turn lets out a blood curdling scream.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS CORRIDOR -
dialogues.text: The team kicks open a door.  Rushes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assault weapons pointed at the bed.  The soldiers yank ba bedsheets to reveal IVAN STRAVANAVITCH, a middle-aged man and his half-naked 18-year-old concubine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Get up, now!  Up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers pull Stravanavitch to his feet and haul him of the room. FOLLOWING -  As they push down the hallway. MANSION SECURITY GUARDS rally with haphazard gunfire. Out come the strike force's flash-bang grenades.  Explodi everywhere, disorienting Stravanavitch's men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signal flares burn as a helicopter descends on the positi The Strike Team evacuates across the field and forces a  struggling Stravanavitch into the low-hovering copter. The commandos swiftly board the craft as a handful of  Stravanavitch's guards break into the clearing.  They ope fire. And the mounted machine guns on the helicopter return. One of the Strike Team members takes a bullet to the neck He's' pulled by his comrades into the chopper as it lifts into the sky, its guns spitting lead...

dialogues.speaker: STRIKE FORCE LEADER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Archangel, this is Restitution. Archangel, this is Restitution.  The package is wrapped. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Restitution.  We are standing  by for delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUNDS of a dinner banquet.   Forks clanking against plates and  the din of a hundred conversations,  broken by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DING, DING, DING of a SPOON tapping against a wine gl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of men and women in formal evening wear sit at r banquet tables.  A HUSH falls over the guests as the DING continues.  All attention turns to the front table. A rotund, silver haired-man in his late sixties rises and sidles past U.S. and Russian flags up to the podium  microphone.  He is STOLI PETROV, President of Russia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Thank you for joining us this evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petrov's harsh Russian issues through the room.  But over we hear a young woman's voice translating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight we are honored to have with  us a man of remarkable courage, who,  despite strong international  criticism...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT TABLE -
dialogues.text: A translator's words ring in the earpiece of a handsome m in his mid-forties.  Worry lines crease his forehead and touch of gray at his temples attest to three very difficu years in office. This man is JAMES MARSHALL, and he is the PRESIDENT of th UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.  He busily makes last minute ch to his speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (V.0. earpiece) Has chosen to join our fight against  tyranny in forging a new world  community.  Ladies and gentlemen, I  give you the President of the United  States of America...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President. Thunderous applause as Marshall rises and approaches the  podium. At the back of the room, DOHERTY, a senior policy adviser whispers to the President's Chief of Staff ED SHEPHERD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should consider running him  for re-election instead of the U.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The applause dies as Marshall begins to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian with  subtitles) Good evening and thank you.  First I  would ask you to join me in a moment  of silence for the victims of the  Turkmenistan massacres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room remains silent a few beats.  Most guests respect bow their heads. Marshall begins again, but this time in English.  The you woman translates simultaneously for the Russian audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, three weeks ago American  Special Forces, in cooperation with  the Russian Republican Army, secured  the arrest of Turkmenistan's self- proclaimed dictator, General Ivan  Stravanavitch, whose brutal sadistic  reign had given new meaning to the  word horror.  I am proud to say our  operation was a success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applause from the audience.  Marshall turns the page on h speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now, yesterday's biggest threat  to world peace... today awaits trial  for crimes against humanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the applause, Marshall pulls a page from the speec folds it and slides it into his pocket.  He removes his  glasses and looks out into the crowd.  His tone becomes m personal. He's not reciting the speech anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we did here was important.  We  finally pulled our heads out of the  sand, we finally stood up to the  brutality and said "We've had enough.   Every time we ignore these atrocities--  the rapes, the death squads, the  genocides- every time we negotiate  with these, these thugs to keep them  out of gig country and away from gig  families, every time we do thiS.E.  we legitimize terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terror is not a legitimate system of government.  And to  those who commit the atrocities I say, we will no longer  tolerate, we will no longer negotiate, and we will no lon be afraid.  It's your turn to be afraid. Applause rolls through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprawling terminals spread out to runways like tentacles.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TARMAC -
dialogues.text: Bathed in floodlights, perched majestically on the runway dwarfing nearby commuter and military jets, stands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President's own Boeing 747-200,  dubbed "the flying White House".   The distinctive royal blue stripe  over a thin gold line tapers to a  tail adorned with the American flag  and the Presidential Seal Secret  Service agents and Marines stand  guard at the aircraft's perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RUSSIAN NEWS VAN emerges from the darkness and pulls to stop by a Secret Service barricade. SPECIAL AGENT GIBBS greets the Russian news team that eme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, welcome to Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please present your equipment to Special Agent Walters fo inspection. The news team's segment producer, a crusty old Russian na KORSHUNOV raises his big bushy eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already been inspected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, this plane carries the President  of the United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though we wish to extend your press service every courtes you will comply with our security measures to the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov and the FIVE MEMBERS of his news crew present t video cameras, sound equipment and supplies to Special Ag WALTERS for inspection.  Secret Service DOGS sniff throug the baggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please place your thumbs on the ID  pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov puts his thumb on the ID pad of a portable comp The computer matches up his thumbprint with his dossier a photograph.  "CLEARED" flashes on the computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President, walking with his entourage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *                     CBS said they'll  give us four minutes.  They thought  the Russian was a nice touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always wondered if my freshman  Russian class would come in handy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you threw out page two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn right I did.  I asked for a  tough-as-nails speech and you gave  me diplomatic bullshit.  What's the  point in having a speech if I have  to ad-lib?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a good ad-lib, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  Wrote it last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President exits the building and enters his limousine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walters hands the bags back to the Russians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Equipment checks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A striking woman in her early thirties descends Air Force One's stairway.  MARIA MITCHELL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this is Maria Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press Relations for the Presidential Flight Office.  She' take you from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms.  Mitchell.  So nice to finally  meet you in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President and I were delighted  that we could accommodate you.  Now  if you're all cleared? (Gibbs nods) You can follow me then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ascend into the belly of Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *                    I'll be giving  you a brief tour, then during the  flight, two members of your crew  will be allowed out of the press  area at a time for filming.  You  will have exactly ten minutes with  the President and twenty with the  crew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winding its way down narrow cobblestone streets onto a ma thoroughfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limousine is packed with advisers, aides, military st including LT. COL. PERKINS, the keeper of the NUCLEAR FOO handcuffed to his wrist.  In the b.g. on the limo's telev set, the LARRY KING SHOW indulges in its normal banter. Marshall wearily rubs his temples as he stifles a yawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna knock of f?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  I'm fine.  What did the  Speaker say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and the NRA don't like the wording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently taking uzis away from  sixth graders isn't as popular as we  thought it'd be.  Representative  Taylor is working on a compromise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put together a score sheet.  I'll  make some calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, sir, maybe you  should give them this one.  Your  numbers are still pretty low and you  called in a lot of chips to nail  Stravanavitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might still have a few chips left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *                     We could always  put you in a duck blind with a twelve  gauge.  The second amendment types'll  love that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a crime bill, Shep.  Killing  a couple ducks won't get it through  committee.  Besides, Shep, I told  you...  I don't shoot babies and I  don't kiss guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other way around, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing what he  said) Right... Christ I'm tired.  Do me a  favor and keep me away from the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall's watch alarm beeps and he automatically reaches into his breast pocket, pulls out a medicine vial and dow two pills with a coffee chaser. On the T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and your reaction to the  President's trip to Moscow.  Good or  bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd turns up the volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the part I wanted you to  see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Criminal.  One of our boys died in  Marshall's little publicity stunt  and for what?  So we could claim  victory over another country's  problems instead of our own?  And  now he's got the nerve to prance  around Moscow gloating, while that  poor boy's family is left to bury  him.  If I were Marshall, I'd be  ashamed of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you have it.  Harsh words for  the President from Michael Danforth,  the Speaker of the House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall mutes the television.  A quiet moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *                     My opinion.   We can't let him get away with that  kind of language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall considers.  Then decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bait.  Don't take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the Speaker of the House attacked  this administration on national  television.  You can't afford to  leave that hanging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Shepherd) Did we tape the Duke game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's waiting on the plane.  The ending  was pretty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Please don't tell me.  Just for once,  *                     let me be  surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria Mitchell escorts the Russians down the plane's leng As they pass the galley, Maria motions up a set of stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up on the upper deck is the cockpit  and the Mission Communication Center.   The MCC, as we call it, can place  clear and secure phone calls to  anywhere on earth.  We're linked to  a network of military and civilian  satellites and ground stations.  We  could run the country or run a war  from there if we had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a remarkable aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know the half of it.  Did  you know this entire plane is shielded  from radiation?  We could fly through  a mushroom cloud completely unharmed  if necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dubious distinction, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it depends on your  perspective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk by several conference rooms, running down the  starboard side of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all these rooms here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conference rooms, though some have  other functions.  The one up front  doubles as an emergency medical  center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past the conference rooms, they walk by a small side room where SECRETARIES work on computers, generating documents

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can see, back here's more  like a regular plane.  Security and  Secret Service take this cabin. You'll be in the rear with the press  pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REAR PRESS CABIN, just ahead of the rear galley and b of bathrooms.  A handful of disgruntled reporters feign s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a press kit.  I'll let you  guys get comfortable and once we're  airborne I'll be able to schedule  the interviews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell exits forward.  One of the reporters stirs and l up at the news team.  He groans.  Space is a premium back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fellas win some sort of fly-with- POTUS contest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potus?  What is Potus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.T.U.S. President Of The United  States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, no.  We won nothing.  We are  ITAR-TASS news service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Listen, this here... This is  my row.  You'll have to sit over  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov trades looks with his news team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President's motorcade pulls up in front of Air Force  One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President and his entourage ascend from the lower dec platform onto the main deck.  COL. DANIEL AXELROD, Air Fo One's pilot, snaps off a salute as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returns salute) Hey Danny.  How's it look tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glassy, sir.  Care to take the wheel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep offering, one of these days  I'll take you up on it. (to no one in  particular) Rose and Alice back yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mr. President.  The ballet ran  late.  Their ETA is seventeen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall nods as he pulls off his bow tie and enters his  stateroom.  Shepherd follows two steps behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall halts Shepherd with a gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd nods and waits by the door.  Lt. Col. Perkins ta a seat outside the Presidents stateroom and opens the lat Tom Clancy thriller, using the nuclear football as a lap  desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall collapses on the couch, rubs his eyes, then clos them.  A moment of peace in a breakneck day. The knock at the door jars him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I at least issue a press release  objecting to the Speaker's choice of  wording?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Marshall picks up one of the many phones in his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said it's not worth the fight. (into phone) Steward, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll just say it was in bad taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, Shep.  The kid gave his life for his country a the Speaker's a bastard for turning him into a sound bite.  I take the heat.  Understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give me ulcers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STEWARD enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mike.  Could you get me a  Heineken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait.  Get him one of the Russian  beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steward nods and disappears from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got those Russian news guys on  board and it'll look good in the  papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall picks up a stack of policy reports.  Thumbs thro them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Shep.  I've been eating borscht  and drinking vodka for days.  Isn't  that enough? (off paper) New home starts are down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steward arrives with the Russian beer.  Marshall take swig.  He swallows hard.  Piss-water.  Marshall crosses t his sink and pours the beer out.  He hands the bottle to steward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill this with Heineken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steward nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this.  I'm playing  politics with a bottle of beer.  A  goddamn bottle of beer.  I've been  in office too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look on the bright side... if the  polls don't change, you won't have  that problem, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall picks up the phone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Put the Duke game on in my  room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE Air Force SPECIALISTS man the elaborate communicati system occupying much of the upper deck.  Top-of-the-line computers, communication systems, video decks, and satell receivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides in a videotape and channels the feed to the * president's stateroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A monitor comes to life with a basketball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Shepherd) Defense and State Department in the  conference room in one hour.  I want  to review the Iraq situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd exits as Marshall settles into his leather chair and dives into work.  He punches a button on the speakerp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the Housing Secretary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marine Guards snap to attention once again as the Fir Lady's motorcade arrives. ROSE MARSHALL, a self-assured woman with an aristocratic  gleam, alights from her limo.  She takes a few steps, the turns, tapping her foot impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Alice, we're 20 minutes late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father's gonna have a fit. ALICE, the President's 13-year-old daughter, straggles ou of the car, rolling her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like he hasn't made us wait  a few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you aren't the President, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the First Lady's entourage enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go say hi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Alice rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you tonight?   Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose pulls Alice aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to say hi to your  father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he's busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you even want to ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice toes her foot into the carpet as she releases an  exasperated sigh.  She is, in this moment, the patron sai of know-it-all 13-year-old girls.  Alice waves toward the Presidential Suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I go over there to say hi to daddy  President, Mike's going to tell me  he's in a meeting and can't be  disturbed.  Then when the plane starts  to taxi, he'll come out and say "Hey,  are you guys back?  Did you enjoy  the ballet?"  But he'll be on his  way to another meeting and won't  wait for an answer.  Then you'll get  pissed at him and he'll get pissed  at you.  It's like you guys rehearse  or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the weight of the entire world on her shoulders, Ali Collapses into one of the many leather chairs.  It seems swallow her.  JORY, a steward passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Joey, how `bout a cocoa, double  whip cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, just this once, give it a rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're jet-lagged.  We'll talk about  this back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at The Fishbowl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice eyes the swirl of Aides who are pretending to work  nearby. But it's obvious that they're eavesdropping.  Alice smile and waves at them dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk at home. (beat) You know, most girls aren't as lucky  as you.  For most girls seeing the  Bolshoi ballet would be the experience  of a lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Mom. (sees the hurt in her  mom's eyes and softens) It was great... really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose nods, smiling a half-smile.  After a thoughtful beat Alice gets up and crosses to the Presidential suite.  She exchanges words with the Aide standing outside the door a comes back, covering her disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in a meeting.  He can't be  disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay.  After all, he is the  President, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey the steward hands her her cocoa with a wink and a sm Her eyes light up at the mound of whip cream on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I write my memoirs I think I'll  devote an entire chapter to the cocoa  aboard Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father never means to be so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... (beat) But lotsa times I feel like it's me  versus the world.  Some kid at school  teases me and the same day a plague  breaks out in Bangladesh.  I mean it  doesn't take a genius to figure which  is more important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kids were teasing you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not really the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet pause, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right and I'll tell you a  secret.  I know exactly how you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big secret.  You said the same thing  to Newsweek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane jolts forward as it begins to taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taxiing.  Ready.  And... five...   four... three.. two... one... Cue  Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice points.  And as if on cue, Marshall exits from his  office and checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooh, I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys back already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was... (thinks, then remembers) ...the ballet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (theatrically) It was the experience of a lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout a hug for the old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice rises and hugs her father.  A White House PHOTOGRAP snaps off a few shots for the papers.  Alice makes a face them.  A second later, Shepherd comes up the corridor,  breaking up the pair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President... they're ready for  you in the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Hey, pumpkin, you'll tell me  all about it later, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Marshall moves toward the conference room, he bends an gives Rose a quick peck on the cheek.  It all reeks of  formality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak to you for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't it wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mr. President.  It can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose shuts the door behind them.  As she starts to speak, Marshall pulls her into a long passionate kiss.  Rose pul away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.  I know spin control when I  feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose, I don't have time for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta go stop a war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For godsakes, Jim, slow down and  stop acting like the little dutch  boy.  Not even you can plug all the  world's leaks.  Don't you think it's  a sign you're pushing too hard when  your daughter sees more of you on  MTV news than in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a big girl.  She understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know she understands?   You haven't spent more than five  minutes with her, or me, in weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when have I had five minutes? When I wake up in the morning and  I'm already three hours behind  Schedule.  What do you want me to  do, Rose, tell the G7 to fuck off  because I'm a family man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. That wasn't fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you. And I miss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's the point, Jim. We're                      right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish it were that easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long beat. He smiles at her, it's the same sweet smile th won her heart, the same smile that got him elected. She  softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it up to you, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should trust that promise? Because  you know the voters are still waiting  for that middle class tax cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This promise isn't subject to  Congressional approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. The tension breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did your speech go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they aren't burning me in  effigy. That's always a good sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again, this time for real. But... a knock on th door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look on the bright side, hon. Shep  here thinks I'll be a one termer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I ask the Chief of Staff to  schedule your daughter in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is scheduled. Her school play's  Tuesday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The First Lady was making a joke,  Shep. I'll make some time, Rose. I  promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall heads for his meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Col. Axelrod and his co-pilot LT. COL. ARTHUR INGRAHAMS a at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: United States Air Force One, this is  tower. It's an honor to clear you  for immediate take-off on runway  three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Tower. And thank you for the  hospitality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axeirod eases up the throttle and the four GE-F103 Turbof engines spring to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A picture perfect take-off as Air Force One slides throug the moonlight and skates upward on a sheet of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airborne in the midnight sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aircraft engines drone. CLOSE ON - A coffee pot pouring piping joe into a mug  emblazoned with ubiguitou Presidential Seal. The mug is p on a tray with a half-dozen other mugs and passed to a ST He carries the tray down the corridor past passenger cabi Drowsiness has overtaken the plane. Many of the passenger and aides are asleep. CNN plays On T.V. sets, entertainin the few night owls and news junkies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an unusually aggressive speech,  the President characterized the  Stravanavitch regime as thugs whose  brutality will no longer be tolerated.   Meanwhile, in Turkmenistan,  Stravanavitch's ouster has sent the  country into turmoil.  Tens of  thousands of refugees continue to  huddle in U.N. safe havens, as rival  Stravanavitch loyalists fight among  themselves for control. But at least  for the time being, the ethnic  cleansing has been stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toward the front of the plane, the steward enters the  conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the steward closes the door behind him, all background noise disappears. We are in a sound shielded room. Even t engines' drone cannot be heard. The lights in the room are dim as MAJOR CALDWELL, a milit advisor, projects satellite photos of Iraqi military base onto a screen. The steward serves coffee as unobtrusively as he can whil the meeting continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our KH-ll's took this one at 0100  hours. What you see here is the  mobilization of two mechanized  brigades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've gotta be joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Iraqi ambassador is claiming  it's just an exercise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An exercise in futility. Send the  Nimitz back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The northern border's gotten a bit  hairy. Their MiGs are playing tag  with our Tomcats and our boys are  just itching to engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell our boys to cool their jets. I  don't need `em creating policy for  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow the steward as he slips out of the conference r and back into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with a few coffees left on his tray. One of them is scoop up by Gibbs as he passes, his nose is buried in a fax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs leans in the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Walters, you and Johnson come  here a second. Reykjavik just sent  the advance team report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Agents Walters and JOHNSON rise and follow Gibbs  into an adjoining office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs closes the door behind the two agents. As Walters a Johnson take their seats, Gibbs WITHDRAWS HIS WEAPON and. SHOOTS each of the agents in THE BACK OF THE HEAD. Silenced pistol. Blood all over the desk. Gibbs removes e of the agent's weapons and slips them into his waistband. waits a few beats, takes a long sip of coffee, then exits the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he passes through the cabin he takes a silent inventor Five other agents working, sleeping, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs nods to Korshunov. Korshunov nods one of his men.   NEVSKY removes one of his videotapes, pops the front cove exposing the tape. Across the face of the tape is a thin  strip of a rubbery substance. Nevsky pulls the strip up a out, making a kind of fuse. He reaches for a pack of  matches... courtesy matches, sporting the Seal of the  President. Nevsky nods and lights the fuse.

dialogues.speaker: IN A RAPID SUCCESSION -
dialogues.text: GIBBS tosses his two extra weapons to Korshunov's men, pi the corner and begins firing at his colleagues. The SECRE SERVICE AGENTS try to get at their weapons, but Gibbs has caught them completely off-guard. Several silenced central nervous system shots (head and n and the five agents slump back, their red blood cascading down the creases of the fine Corinthian leather chairs. Nevsky tosses the cassette up the corridor... smoke pours out of it. Smoke screen. BAZYLEV and ZEDECK catch the guns Gibbs tossed and hold t on the reporters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP! GET UP NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bazylev grabs the stunned reporters, yanking them into th aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk in front of us. Go! Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human shields. A half dozen of them. Behind the terrorists, one of the bathroom doors swings o A SECRET SERVICE AGENT emerges. Sees what's happening. Re for his gun. ZEDECK fells him with a well placed unsilenc GUN SHOT. SCREAMS ensue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleeping SECRET SERVICE AGENT bolts upright. HEARS MORE SHOTS. He springs up and moves toward the gunshots, his weapon d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS FIRED! SECURE BOY SCOUT! (screaming out and  into his lapel mike) SHOTS FIRED! SHOTS FIRED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bazylev and Zedeck lay down a suppressing fire outside th door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov, Nevsky and VLAD follow Gibbs into the Secret  Service office. Gibbs opens a locker and pulls out a stas of MP5 automatic assault rifles and bullet-proof vests. Korshunov raises his bushy eyebrows in delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secret Service believes in being  prepared for any eventuality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secret Service agent fights his way through the smoke a wall panel. Punches a red buttoned intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red light on the security panel lights up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a code red, I repeat, code  red. Shots fired onboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cot. AXELROD Cabin/Flight Deck: Code Red Acknowledged...  Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into headset  microphone) Warsaw tower this is Air Force One.  Declaring Emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axelrod toggles his headset to secure line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ranstein Air Base, this is Air Force  One Heavy. We have a code red. Shots  fired onboard, request priority  redirect. Please acknowledge.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Hunched over a control terminal, the AIR TRAFFIC CONTROLL tracks Air Force One's radar image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me. GO WAKE THE GENERAL. NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WATCH OFFICER springs into action, picking up a phone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One Heavy, acknowledged. You are on our scope. Please state  fuel remaining and souls onboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty seven souls onboard, we're  okay with fuel. Request secure  military escort with emergency medical  standing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One Heavy, acknowledged. We are scrambling our fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The controller hits a red button on his console. Sirens f up and klaxons wail across the base. The controller looks down to his runways. In the light of the moon he sees a half-dozen men rushing toward F-15 Eag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Berlin Tower. Not a plane lands  or takes off within two hundred miles!  Understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The once sleepy midnight control room cranks into full cr mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium. GUNFIRE pops in the b.g. Air Force Specialis try to get the word out.

dialogues.speaker: A.F. SPECIALIST
dialogues.text: General Greely? No sir, Interrupt her. This is       this is Air Force One. We Air Force One with an        have a  code red. Shots emergency call.              have been fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conference room door bursts open and TWO SECRET SERVI AGENTS, weapons drawn, enter the room and run to Marshall The once quiet room floods with light. The sounds of a  gunfight and a blanket of smoke sweeps into the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're under attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're handling it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents lift Marshall to his feet, and practically car him from the room, leaving the other high ranking officia to scramble for themselves in a cacophony of shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The launch codes! Who's protecting  the football?

dialogues.speaker: FORWARD CORRIDOR -
dialogues.text: Perkins, carrying the nuclear football, ducks and weaves way down the corridor into the fray. He takes a bullet to the shoulder, which fells him.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE FORWARD GALLEY -
dialogues.text: Alice is nearly trampled by agents responding to the gunf One agent grabs her and shoves her into a bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't open the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNFIRE pops all around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke, automatic weapons fire. Secret service agents batt the terrorists. Aides, diplomats, crew and personnel caug in the crossfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down! Everybody down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spray of weapons fire overhead and everyone hits the fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAY DOWN, PLACE YOUR HANDS BEHIND  YOUR HEAD AND YOU WILL NOT BE SHOT!

dialogues.speaker: RAMSTEIN A.B. CONTROLLER, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: Air Force One Heavy, you are cleared for priority divert, all runways are clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warsaw Tower has cleared local  airspace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Changing course heading to 276 point  five. Dropping to twenty thousand  feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shots can be heard outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrahams, make sure that door's  locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ingrahams locks the cockpit door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One banks into a curve and descends through bro clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of gunfire have reached the the nose of the pl Rose peers out to see what's the matter. An armed Secret  Service agent runs toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! Get back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spray of bullets mows him down. He collapses in the doo frame. Terrified, Rose tries to close the door, but the d agent is in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with smoke and gunfire. The agents rush the Presid behind a forward bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) We have Boy Scout, traveling forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative... negative... they're up  here too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. We're going to the chute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall looks up the hallway toward his stateroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) ROSE! ALICE!

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE CORRIDOR -
dialogues.text: Gibbs fires. HITS - One of the Secret Service agents in the shoulder.  Blood blossoms through his clothes but he winces it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secret Service agents whisk the President to the fron stairwell. They pull up a floor panel, revealing stairs  descending toward the baggage deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, huddled atop the commode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice opens the door and rushes... INTO THE CORRIDOR... Tripping and falling over Joey, the steward. His dead eye swim in a pool of blood that was his face. Alice screams, scrambling to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: MID-PLANE CORRIDOR -
dialogues.text: Perkins manages to push himself to his feet and stumbles  down the hall into the computer room. Terrorist SERGE spo the nuclear football dangling from his wrist. He pursues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hysterical SECRETARIES feverishly dump classified documen into a shredder, while Perkins struggles to open the blac leather briefcase handcuffed to his wrist. Bullets tear up the doorknob lock arid SERGE kicks in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down! Everyone down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fawn Halls hit the floor as gunfire sprays overhead. Perkins swings around brandishing his sidearm. He opens f on Serge, but the bullets smack harmlessly against the SW vest. Serge returns fire, ripping up Perkins who collapses over the shredder, and with his last bit of strength, he dumps out the briefcase. Papers containing NUCLE WAR STRATEGIES and MISSILE LAUNCH CODES slide into the hungry Shredding machine. Perkins ma a slight smile before he keels over dead, his duty fulfil The shredded remains of the nuclear football rain over hi head like tickertape at a hero's parade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pale moon catches shiny streaks of metal that descend through the broken clouds. The Squadron of F-15 Eagles dr into formation around Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun shots right Outside the cockpit door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One, this is Squadron  Commander Canton. You are now under  escort. All airspace has been cleared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Air Force One Heavy. I'm  coming in full throttle. ETA to  Ranstein eight minutes. We've got a  war here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Encased in a helmet, mask, and visor, Carlton watches the flashes of gunfire in the dark windows of the plane. COt. CARLTON Copy. Delta Force has been mobilized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the main cabin, the Secret Service agents run the President through the forward baggage compartment and the lower galley: a large room with compartments, storage fre and food preperation tables. On the far side of the galley, the agents fling open a  hatchway and enter... A NARROW GANGWAY - running between the lower galley and t rear baggage hold, flanked on either side by the landing  gear bays. They duck under wing supports until they come to a mesh  grating. The uninjured agent lifts the grating revealing an ESCAPE POD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second later gunfire rips Up the agent's face. The new  volley sends Marshall under the cover of a wing strut. Th second agent takes Position and returns fire. He quells t incoming volley for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a family, too, sir. Now get  in the fucking pod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The firing begins again. Marshall struggles with the deci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President... MR. PRESIDENT! You  have to do this! The pod, on three. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent shoves in a fresh clip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Two... THREE. GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent combat-rolls into the open and fires. He advanc down the gangway acting as a shield for the president,  shooting blindly.  Marshall watches as he's hit repeatedl but it gives him the time he needs to dive for the pod.

dialogues.speaker: VLAD AND NEVSKY
dialogues.text: behind the bulkhead. When the agent drops, Nevsky and Via rush down the gangway. They arrive at the closed pod just it begins to slide on its rails. They let loose dozens of rounds from their MP55, but the bullets just plink off. The pod-lock doors slide shut. The President is on his wa to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small bay doors open in the belly of Air Force One, and a human sized cannister drops from the bottom, its parachut Opening instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light flashes On the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Ramstein/Air Force One: Emergency  pod has been deployed. I repeat,  emergency pod has been deployed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Ramstein. Acknowledged. We  are picking up the homing beacon and  deploying search and rescue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy Ramstein. We are dropping to  five thousand feet, beginning final  approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy? Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice comes closer, filled with choking fear and pani She rounds the corner and Nevsky catches her hair with a  vice-tight grip shoving his MP5 into the small of her bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father has left you behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov kicks open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire from ROSE, who holds the dead secret service agen weapon. She empties the clip at the doorway. Click, click No more bullets. Korshunov steps into the room, brandishi his automatic, smiling. Rose backs against the wall and r her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Marine helicopte touches down on the greenway. Marines  salute and escort KATHERINE CHANDLER from the chopper'  interior to the South entrance of the White House. She is the VICE PRESIDENT of the UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck steps over the three dead Communications Specialis on his way to the cockpit door. Tries the door. It's lock He pounds on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the cockpit window, the glowing landing lights of Ramstein Base are visible in the distance, cutting a wedg through the German towns and fields. Zedeck's pounding continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramatein, we are fifteen miles away  on final approach. I'm coming in  fast and will need every inch of  runway.

dialogues.speaker: RAMSTEIN A.B. CONTROLLER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Copy, Air Force One. Wind is twelve knots from the east.  Tactical and emergency are in position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescue vehicle sirens gyre in the darkness. A team of bla faced commandos unload from troop truck. Snipers take pos atop rescue vehicles, barracks, and the control tower. High-powered rifles with infra-red scopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck aims his MP5 at the flight door. Fires off a dozen rounds. Nickel sized indentations blossom across the stee surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dull thuds of bullet impacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get this crate on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're some real good men waiting to help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane sprouts landing gear as it descends over the ci Coming in fast and low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs shoves Zedeck aside. Produces a thumb-sized amount C-4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final approach... the landing strip not far at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his flaps. Air speed and altitude drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotters find Air Force One's navigation lights visible i the sky, descending from the distant darkness. Followed b the cluster of F-lSs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs rolls out the C-4 like a kid making a snake in pott class. He presses it along the door seal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Altitude decreasing. 300 feet... 200 hundred feet... The runway coming up to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the entire airbase collectively holds its breath. Air  Force One's tires hover 50 feet above the ground... 40 fe 30...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs raises his pistol. Aims at the C-4. Fires. BAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLINDING FLASH. The door blows in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheels touchdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs and Zedeck storm the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: RNT. FLIGHT DECK
dialogues.text: Axeirod gropes at the plane's controls, trying to retain wheel. Gibbs dispatches Axeirod with one shot. Zedek is a little messier with Ingrahams. But both pilot and co-pilo slump over their controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxiing Boeing 747 suddenly veers to the right cuttin across runways. Emergency vehicles give chase. The plane bounces. Is airborne for a second. Touches down again with a jolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrorists lead hostages to the conference room. Everyone bounced around, slamming against walls, spilling over cha A MASTER SERGEANT seizes the opportunity and grabs for  Bazylev's gun, but Bazylev shoots him almost point blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep moving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. Gibbs tries to pull Axelrod off the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throttle up. Throttle up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedek slams the throttle all the wa up. Spotlights and si swirl outside the cockpit window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Flying White House careens toward the barracks, then  edges toward a hangar. The jet engines strain to reach fu power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The controller stares down at the out-of-control plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw Fuck. We're losing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs pulls Axeirod's body out of the pilot's seat. Looks out the cockpit window and sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in his path. A monstrous plane, every  bit as big as Air Force One. Gibbs  eases back on the wheel and the 747  sluggishly responds, its nose creeping  upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adjusts the flaps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One closes in on the Starlifter. She's struggli off the ground like some injured bird. The straining metal de gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs senses that he's too close. He pulls way back on th stick, risks stalling her out... but the bird responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One barely clears the Starlifter, the edge of h wing just missing the top of the C-141's tail. The sharpshooters, the emergency crews, the commandos fro Delta Force...  Nothing they can do but watch her rise ou of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs and Zedeck. Gibbs checks over all the instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, 30,000 feet. Give me my heading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bearing 110 point eight two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs banks the plane into a curve, then activates the au pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me if something changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fly a 747 you need to know three  things. How to take of f, how to  land, and how to engage the autopilot.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS--
dialogues.text: The terrorists, from every corner of the plane, lead the  stunned survivors, hands on heads, to the central confere room. As Korshunov walks Rose up the corridor, he meets up with Gibbs, descending from the upper deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the secret service?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many others killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs touches his bulletproof vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No damages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's alive, ma'am, for the time  being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose allows herself a half-sob of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secret service did their job,  ma'am. The President is safely off  the plane. (to Korshunov) But that still leaves us plenty to  bargain with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes filled with hatred... Rose SLAPS Gibbs face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gibbs. You, of all people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs doesn't react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High-tech maps and communications systems line the walls, surrounding an austere main conference table. Laptop comp and secure telephones by every seat. Side tables. Tele-ty machines spitting out classified information. VICE PRESIDENT CHANDLER analyzes the projected course of Force One on the tactical vid-map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have the President secure  within minutes. Do we know who these  terrorists are or where they're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENERAL NORTHWOOD, head of the Joint Chiefs of Staff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Greely says it looks like  the Middle East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your office have anything to  add, Mr. Dean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Security Advisor WALTER DEAN leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garners believe that, given the  scenario, there's an 86% chance that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we'll be dealing with a hostage situation and not an  assassination attempt. Not much else until there's more d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're dealing with an airborne  hostage situation what's our  procedure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Under-Secretary of Defense, THOMAS LEE, punches up a  scenario on the lap-top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our only policy assumes the plane is  on the ground. Our hands are  completely tied while they're in the  air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Gentlemen, we'll take no action  until we confirm that the president  is off the plane... Lee, go huddle  with the D.O.D. I want an options  paper on this in 20 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me. (points to an aide) You. Congress and cabinet heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aide nods and picks up a telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Vice-President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chandler turns toward the door. The Colonel enters the ro holding a black briefcase identical to Perkins'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Command Authority. All  previous launch codes have been  cancelled. You're carrying the ball  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Colonel. Have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUEY, flanked by a pair of APACHES, skims the surface o wheat fields at maximum velocity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot checks his instruments. He's honing in on a sig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The swirling spotlights of the Apaches finally illuminate the Seal of the President atop the EMERGENCY DEPLOYMENT P The Huey drops in for a landing and a half dozen Army Ran in full combat gear deploy to the pod. They open it. But......... IT'S EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruised and battered, some blood smeared across his tuxed shirt... PRESIDENT JAMES MARSHALL lowers himself from one the overhead wing struts. He emerges into the bowels of Air Force one. He stands quietly a moment, listening... for footsteps, f gunfire. All quiet except for the whine of the jet engine He tak9s a moment to think. Considers his situation. His  eyes find the dead agent who risked his life so he could  make it to the pod. He trots down the gangway toward the  lower galley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One hovers atop billowy peaks. The smaller F-15 cluster around her in a loose formation.

dialogues.speaker: FIGHTER PILOT
dialogues.text: Sir, isn't there something we can do besides escort?

dialogues.speaker: COL. CARLTON, (O.S. RADIO)
dialogues.text: Like what, son... shoot our own plane down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. I just wish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. We all wish... Now shut the  fuck up and escort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall looks around for a weapon... half-full coffee po stove, walk-in freezer, plates and silverware. Marshall p up a butcher knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevsky and Bazylev guard the conference room door as Kors and Vlad enter. Nevsky hands Korshunov a copy of the plan manifest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every weapon and every person is  accounted for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov nods and enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov surveys the hostages. Viad covers them at gunpo Rose holds Alice, comforting her.  shepherd, Doherty, Aid Advisors, Crew... Fifty of them huddle like sardines. The plane's doctor administers to the wounded. Korshunov stares down his captives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear will keep you alive. Any one  who is not afraid is bound to do  something foolish, and bound to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooperation. If you try to escape,  you will be met with automatic gunfire  and a barricade of your comrade's  bodies will prevent you from exiting.  Good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov exits, with Viad backing out behind him. Leavin the hostages alone. The sound of the door locking. A mournful beat. Everyone looks at each other and the dea and wounded victims of this heinous act... Hushed conversation breaks out all over the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be happening. You just  don't pull this shit with the United  States. You just don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caldwell paces, looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Marshall, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all that matters. Thank god  the President got of f the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... thank God. (to caldwell) You there... Caidwell, right? What's  on your mind?  caldwell takes a beat,  then crosses to Rose and Shepherd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed) I don't want to get anybody here  excited, but if we can get out of  this room, I can get us to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're thirty five thousand feet up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, that's a problem, but if  we can somehow get to a lower  altitude, the rear loading ramp on  the baggage deck is equipped with  parachutes in case of an engine  failure. Now we can either wait for  a political resolution, or try to  resolve this thing ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goddamn right we can resolve  this ourselves. We'll negotiate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the President's policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President isn't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now we are an enormous liability  to the United States. We can't just  sit and do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrorists move toward the nose of the plane leaving  Nevsky to guard the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Marshall reaches the front stairway. Cautiously climbs to the main cabin. As he reaches the top stairs, h hears Russian conversation approaching. He ducks back int the stairwell. He can't see them, but he can hear them. The terrorists pass within a few feet as they ascend to t Mission Communications Center on the upper deck. Marshall waits a few beats, listens to the silence. Then mounts the stairs and almost runs into the back of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing guard, facing the opposite  direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall FREEZES... looks past Viad down the corridor whe Nevsky guards the main conference room floor. Unaware of Marshall, Viad reaches into his pocket and pul out a cigarette. Lights it. On the first puff he feels a  presence behind him. VLAD slowly turns around... Nothing there. He smiles at his jittery nerves, turns back round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over Vlad's shoulder... MARSHALL, flattened behind the edge of the galley divider He creeps away from Vlad toward the Presidential Suite... stepping gingerly over dead secret service agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *       Korshunov pulls a handkerchef from his breast poc and wipes the blood from a telephone headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs works the communications board, dialing in a series numbers. Telephone ringing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A map of Air Force One's flight trajectory is displayed o the rear screen. Moscow to Berlin and back toward the Bla Sea. The assembled brass listens as Korshunov's voice slithers off the speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the Chief of Staff, the First  Lady, and the First Daughter.  Our  demands are simple. Arrange the  release of Ivan Stravanvitch.  Once  our leader is returned to Turkuenistan  soil, Air Force One and it's occupants  will be allowed safe passage to  Switzerland. You have one hour before  we start killing hostages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone clicks off. A silent beat in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find that voice for me, I want to  know who we're dealing with. And get  President Petrov on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENERAL CHARLES GREELY, head of the 87th Mechanized Air W the unit responsible for Air Force One, enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Vice-President, we just got  word from Ramstein... The nod was  UntiL Chandler stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President... he must still be  onboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play back that call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tech Officer indexes back on his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is under our command, and  those we did not kill we hold as  hostages, including the Chief of  Staff, the First Lady, and the First  Daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: but not the President. Not the  President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silent beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead then. They must have killed  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the president hostage is not  something that slips your mind when  you're making demands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if he's dead? Do you really think  they'd risk telling us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a possibility we're  overlooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes turn to Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I ran Specops in `Nam, I ordered  the destruction of a V.C.  munitions  dump. During insertion, the plane  was shot down and the entire team  was killed, or so we thought. Two  days later the dump

dialogues.speaker: BLEW AND A WEEK AFTER THAT, THIS 19-
dialogues.text: year-old kid, the pilot... he walks out of the jungle in  pretty bad shape. He survived the crash and finished the  mission... alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, if you have a point, make  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kid's name was Jim Marshall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the President's service record makes for dull rea because most of what he did iarLZ ULirn.   History rememb him for what he did aflar he got back to the states -- th protests, the rallies -- But he was a soldier once, a dam fine one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's alive on that plane and  those bastards don't even know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dean, may I remind you that the  President is not 19 anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall cautiously enters the room. Ready for action. The room is empty, but it's been trashed by the firefight The sound of voices... coming from the Duke game which st plays. Marshall hustles over to one of the secure phones. It's dead. He tries the regular phone. Dead. Hangs it up disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps on some glass. It's a broken frame holding a  PHOTOGRAPH of Alice and Rose. He picks up the photo and l it on a table. He thinks for a beat... glances around the room, searchin Then he crosses to the closet, opens it and begins riflin through his wardrobe. INT. MAIN CONFERENCE ROOM. Caldwell stands on the conference table. The hostages hav removed one of the ceiling panels. Air supply ducts and  bundles of wiring run through the ten-inch space between ceiling and the shielding plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose looks around the room. Hopeless. Her eyes land on th carpet... INT. CORRIDOR. Marshall opens the stateroom door and slowly slides into corridor. Vlad still faces the opposite direction. Marshall creeps down the hallway, when... Beep... Beep... Beep... Marshall's watch alarm goes off. Marshall dives for the nearest doorway. Vlad swings round see a figure slip into the senior staff cabin. Vlad, unsure of what he saw., cautiously heads toward the staff cabin. As he nears, he bends over a dead Secret Ser agent and pulls up the lifeless wrist revealing abeening  watch. It wasn't Marshall's after all. No matter. Vlad  continues to the staff Cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall frantically searches for something he can use as weapon. In the room: some video monitors, leather chairs phones. stainless steel cabinets run the length of one of the walls. Marshall throws the cabinet doors open, revealing... A fully stocked MEDICAL CENTER... fold-down operating table... high-intensity lights. Equipped to deal with any medical emergency the president might encounter. But too late. Vlad kicks the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the floor, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall yanks down the operating table, and it smashes i Vlad, knocking him down. Marshall lunges with his knife, Vlad OPENS FIRE. A HALF DOZEN ROUNDS pump into Marshall's belly. He's thrown back against the wall, then slumps to floor. Vlad approaches the crumpled body. Leans down to examine victim. He cups his hand under the man's chin and lifts h head. Recognizes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wonderment) The President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Marshall's eyes flash open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He springs, shoving the butcher knife under the flack jac and into Vlad's spleen. Vlad freezes, unsure of what just happened. Marshall is on his feet. Never letting go of the twisting knife, he grabs Vlad by the back of the head and slams hi face against the mirror above the surgical scrub sink. Th mirror shatters and streams of blood erupt cn the terrori face. The blood drips down into the white porcelain sink, swirling into the drain. Vlad elbows Marshall in the neck, stunning him momentaril He wipes the blood from his face, spins and hits Marshall with a devastating right cross. Marshall reels back again the wall, and Vlad follows, shoving the MP5 into Marshall throat. Marshall grabs the gun near the trigger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move or I'll blow your head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall presses the saftey button on the gun with his  forefinger, then knees Vlad in the balls. Viad pulls the  trigger repeatedly as he goes down, but nothing happens. Instead he comes up swinging his gun butt against Marshal face. Like a bat hitting a baseball, it knocks Marshall i the medical closet. The gun goes flying, skittering UNDERNEATH A CABINET. Marshall pulls himself up the shelves trying to keep his  legs from buckling. Vlad grabs some I.V. tubing and wraps around Marshall's neck. Marshall struggles for breath, cl at the tube.

dialogues.speaker: HE SPOTS A DEFIBRILLATOR, REACHES AND SWITCHES IT ON. LOW
dialogues.text: pitched hum and beeping. Marshall pulls his head forward, straining against the pl tubing. Then slams back into Vlad's head. Viad releases h grip just for a moment... The beeping becomes a steady whine. ... but a moment is all Marshall needs as he grabs the de ib's CARDIAC PADDLES, turns, and SLAMS them on either sid of Vlad's head. Vlad convulses from the shock for a full five seconds... eyeballs roll, his hair stands on end.  then he collapses the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall catches his breath for a moment. Pulls open his  shirt. Beneath it he wears a bulletproof Kevlar vest. He  lifts the vest and a half-dozen angry welts have blossome across his skin. The stuff may be bulletproof, but each o Vlad's shots sting like a motherfucker. EXT. CORRIDOR. Nevsky walks down the corridor. Sees that Vlad is away fr his post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall opens the medical cabinets, rifling through them Pulls out hypodermics, adrenalin, rubbing alcohol... armi himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vlad? Vlad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevsky works his way up the corridor, peeking in rooms. As he enters the... INT. STAFF CABIN. he's blinded by the high intensity surgical lights. Marshall cracks a tank of anesthesia across Nevsky's heu  Nevsky goes down. Marshall rips Nevsky's MP5 off of him. Holds it to Nevsky throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are th*y? fly tamily, the  crew.... where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevsky says nothing. The conference room, right? Right? Marshall jerks him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: o'11 unlocli the door for me or I'll  kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall walks flevsky toward the mj vonteronve room3 As  they pass the stairs to the upper deck, Nevsky breaks awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KORSKUNOV!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall fires. Killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CORRIDOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time for remorse. Marshall tries the Main conference R door. Locked. He knows the others will be coming so he  flattens himself against the corridor wall. Trains his gu on the stairs. Just as the terrorists descend, Marshall squeezes off a f rounds. The terrorists edge back up the steps, returning  fire. Marshall checks his clip, not many bullets left. He fires off a few more shots to buy some time then ducks round th corner and pulls out the bottle of rubbing alcohol and so gauze. The terrorists seize the moment of quiet, descending the  stairs to take position. Marshall lights the gauze fuse of his new made Molatov cocktail and throws it down the corridor. The bottle cras into a BALL OF FLAME. Catching Bazylev on fire. He yells, drops and rolls. FIRE SUPPRESSING FOAM immediately sprays down from overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serge hops Bazylev's burning body and heads down the corr looking for this new wildcard. Korshunov grabs a fire  extinguisher from the galley and attends to Bazylev. INT.
