CORRIDOR, TOWARD THE REAR OF AIR FORCE ONE. Marshall retreats behind a divider. Sees Serge coming. Fi a few rounds, then retreats to the next divider. Working  toward the rear of the plane. Serge picks his way through the rear cabins, advancing  cautiously. INT. REAR GALLEY/BATHROOMS. Marshall's out of plane. Nowhere to hide in the galley. Marshall eyes the bathrooms, doors flapping. FOLLOWING SERGE... as he reaches the rear galley and bathrooms. Marshall is  nowhere to be seen. But the bathroom doors are all closed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're in there. Come on out. (a few beats) Okay. Have it your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for a deadly version of the shell game. serge fires  several rounds into the first closed bathroom door. The  bullets slice easily through the thin doors. He kicks the riddled door open. The stall is empty. Serge moves to the next one. Same procedure. It's empty. Moves to the last bathroom, confident he's got him. He wa with his MP5, turning the hatch into swiss cheese. Waits beat, then... Kicks it in. It's empty too. Serge looks around. Where the hell is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling down) Serge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serge reluctantly returns to his group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall tumbles out of the cramped galley dumbwaiter,  breathing heavy. He slumps against the bulkhead and slide down to the ground. He takes a moment to pull himself together, to clear his  head. He hefts the MP5, refamiliarizing himself with the  weight and texture of a gun. He checks the clip. Only a  handfull of rounds left. He slaps it back in and switches from automatic fire to single-shot then pantomimes firing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NRA'll love this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down the barrel of the gun, he notices bins loade with luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoli Petrov on the phone, behind his large oak desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand your dilemma, Vice  President Chandler. But unless you  can confirm that your President is  indeed a hostage, I cannot release  Stravanavitch. If Marshall is dead,  no good will come of meeting this  demand. We both know he would agree.

dialogues.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER, (V.0. PHONE)
dialogues.text: But the First Lady...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *.. is not a First Lady if her  husband's been killed. Then she's a  civilian. And I can't release him  for a civilian. Do you see my point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each member of the crisis team is either on the phone or  huddled with staff. A secure fax machine spits out papers which Lee slips into files. Lee interrupts Chandler on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Vice president. We have an  options paper.  chandler takes the  options paper, waves off Lee, and  reads it as she talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You've made yourself quite clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I will deploy forces to a staging  area near the Turkmenistan border.  When you have more information, we  can decide how to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By then I'll be President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chandler hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of f options paper) I don't like any of these. from, did  you brief General Northwood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Northwood pops out of his huddle.

dialogues.speaker: I'M INCLINED TO TRY THIS PART -
dialogues.text: Anticipate their landing site and get strike teams in pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got four hours before they  make it into Turkienistan airspace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a satellite passing overhead in twenty minutes. can narrow down the landing site choices based on runway  length and any unusual activity.  With luck we'll only ha to capture three or four sites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they start executing hostages in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to be pragmatic, but they'll  sacrifice pawns before kings. It may  take them some time to kill their  way up to senior staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Also, I want you to put our  bases in Turkey on alert, and have  the Kitty Hawk prepare a retaliatory  air strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Vice-President...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've not discounted your theory Hr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I got the new numbers from our  gamers. They believe that there's  only an eight percent chance that  the President is still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight percent is better than zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit... what is that? Chandler refers to a monitor in the rear of the room. CNN, the omnipresent player on the world political stage, broadcasts video from Ramstein Air Base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's trouble.

dialogues.speaker: CNN REPORTER, (V.0. T.V.)
dialogues.text: *.. the Presidential Aircraft was enroute from Moscow whe it began its mayday hail. But in a startling turn of even the seemingly out of control plane aborted its landing an took off again. We haven't been able to confirm its statu or whether or not the first family was onboard at the tim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would someone get the Press Secretary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been holding on line four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One, lit up by moonlight. INT. CORRIDOR. The fire is extinguished. Zedeck squats over Nevsky's bod Gibbs and Serge maintain a defensive position, guns ready Bazylev emerges from the Senior staff Conference room. He shakes his head "no". Korshunov nods and furrows his brow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We checked the manifest. Everyone  was accounted for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secret service agent. It must be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wounded but alive. Serge, Bazylev... Find him. Serge and Bazylev lock and load, head off in separate  directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conference room is no longer  secure. We'll take the First Lady  and the girl up top where we can  keep a closer eye on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hostages have torn up a section of carpeting. Caidwel and Shepherd examine the floor. Smooth sheets of steel ri together. Pointless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not getting out that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open and Gibbs and Korshunov enter. They  spots the ripped up carpeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admirable, but you're wasting your  time. (beat) Mrs. Marshall, would you and your  daughter please come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't move. Korshunov raises his gun, points it a  Shepherd's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, or he dies, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doherty steps forward. Shepherd tries to pull him back, t no *       avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the better part of the  White House locked in this room, you  know. If you want to negotiate, we're  the ones to do it with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov SHOOTS Doherty through the head. Screams from s of the hostages. Korshunov squeezes off a few shots to qu everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Marshall. Alice. If you please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose turns to the other hostages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Do what you're told. It's  okay. We'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She locks eyes with Caldwell. HKeep working.N He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President hunts through luggage. Overturned garment b and suitcases around him, belongings littered all over th bulkhead. He sifts through heaps of clothing and finally  recovers what he's been looking for... A CELLULAR PHONE... He flips it open, starts to dial... but freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't remember the number. He dials... CLOSE.ON PHONE -555-1212... Information. The phone rings... INT. FORWARD BAGGAGE HOLD. Bazylev, moving like a commando, slowly and methodically  works his way into the lower galley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall. Finally, the phone picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Information. How can I assist you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washington D.C.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the number for the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest area consists of a couple of bunks behind the cockpit area, still soiled black from the earlier C-4  explosion. Korshunov pours a cup of coffee and offers it Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be tired. It'll wake you  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. The gunfire did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs wraps Rose's hands behind her back with duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave my daughter alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you will do what, Mrs. Marshall? (beat, he chuckles) But I admire your courage. Your  husband, on the other hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know of my husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he left you behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband is a very courageous man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband is a coward. He sends  soldiers half-way around the world  to steal a man from his home in the  middle of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice sits up, attentive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one of Stravanavitch's men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you study world events, little  one. That's good for a girl your  age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I study world events. Five  thousand Turkienistan Muslims were  slaughtered in Stravanvitch's  cleansings... along with 15 American  school kids. You know hQw I studied  that. I went to their funerals with  my dad. I met their parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart for your age, eh? Top of your  class? Tell me, do you know what the  word "propaganda" means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Do you know what the word  "asshole" means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose doesn't know whether to be pissed at Alice or proud her. Korshunov smiles, nods his head and lifts his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I have heard that word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aims his gun at Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, the Korshunov lovers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father is a reasonable man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once he hears our simple demand, I'm sure he will acquies For your sake. Korshunov smiles. Gibbs grabs Alice's hands and pulls the behind her back. Begins wrapping them with the tape. INT. MAIN CABING, REAR GALLEY. Serge searches through the galley cabinets, spots the gal dumbwaiter. Now he knows where his quarry went. He angrily grabs a service cart and shoves it into the  dumbwaiter, disabling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bazylev hears the beeps of a phone dialing. He moves towa the aft portal of the gangway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall waits as the phone rings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chipper woman in her mid-20s picks up the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White House switchboard. How may I  direct your call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed urgency) Okay listen, listen carefully. This  is an emergency call from Air Force  One. Who's there? Is the Vice- President there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who can I say is calling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cut me off. This is an  emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the President does not call  this particular number. So whoever  you are get a life, before I have  this call traced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. This is an  emergency. Let me talk to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The switchboard operator thinks for a moment. Maybe she c have some fun with this nutcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... if you're the President,  when's your wife's birthday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look lady, I don't have time for  games. Just put the....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for calling the white  House...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. no. no. Wait. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bazylev appears behind Marshall. Raises his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should know this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's June.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? Are you there? Sir? Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face says N. The Switchboard operator pulls out a cal sheet and finds a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the phone, lying open on a heap of clothing. Bazylev points the machine gun at Marshall's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands away from your weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall doesn't move, his np5 hanging at his waist... hi hand inches from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now. You don't want to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall... with no options... slowly moves his hands awa from the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your knees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Is anyone there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bazylev motions Marshall to get on his knees. Marshall  complies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that in your shirt? Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall pulls his shirt aside revealing his Kevlar vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it off. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chandler on the phone. An aide waves, trying to get her  attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My intention is not to escalate the  situation, but it's a contigency  that must be considered. Hang on... (to Aide) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The switchboard says that someone  called in claiming to be the  President, then she heard gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caller's gone, but the line's still active.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be some crank watching CNN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. Trace confirms the call is  Coming from a White House staff  cellular account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it through down here. (into phone) Hang on, Toni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The call comes in on speaker phone, distorted muffled voi and the whine of an aircraft in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on in the background?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we hear what's going on? Dean picks up a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, get me Willis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIS, a grossly overweight man in his late forties  surrounded by a monolith of high-tech, starts working his console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking... Intercepting call... Got  it. Ten seconds, Mr. Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audio waveforms appear over Willis' console. He implement digital filtering routines, cleaning up the sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group listens intently. The call modulates, distorts, dissolves... then clarifies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands... hands behind your head, Mr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him. He is alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to take your weapon now,  and then I'm going to take you  Upstairs to join the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, they have him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you make any sudden moves, I  will not hesitate to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they don't have him yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Northwood stares up at the tactical board. Air Force One. surrounded by the F-l5s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And maybe we aren't so helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Northwood picks up a secure phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Greely, Air Force One has  automatic countermeasures, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything we own is in that plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So a single missile launched from a  distance should be a mere distraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theoretically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Ramutein Tower Control, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting it) But the effect could be jarring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Ramstein? General  Northwood... Patch me through to  your fighters. Madame Vice  President... with your permission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall on his knees, hands behind his head. Bazylev, hi automatic pressed against Marshall's forehead, disarms  Marshall before stepping away. He slings Marshall's MP5 o his own neck. Studies Marshall a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the President. Somehow, I  thought you'd be smaller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall stares straight ahead tn silent defiance. Bazyle kicks him in the gut. Marshall doubles over, wheezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so powerful now, eh? No aides to  advise you, no secret service to  protect you, no armies to command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bazylev grabs Marshall's hair and tugs his head back. He  holds Marshall with his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll suffer for what you've done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *                    So will you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bazylev slams Marshall's face against his knee. Marshall  slumps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up. Get up now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall slowly rises to his feet. Bazylev swings wide ar him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will walk ahead... slowly. Do  you understand? (no response) Do you understand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what's going to happen  to you because of this? Do you know  what the world will do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. The world will do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is what they've always done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serge seals off the second dumbwaiter.
The Squadron of F-15 Eagles hover around Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the order. And do not, I  repeat, do not take your best shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, sir. Okay boys, clear the  deck. I have been ordered to engage  Air Force One.

dialogues.text: The other airplanes flare out giving distance to the Jumb Jet. Canton's plane drops back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assuming attack posture. Targeting  computer is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On TARGETING COMPUTER - Graphics: As it acquires Air Forc One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Target is acquired. I have good tone  CLOSE ON: The flight stick. Carlton's  finger over the firing button. He  hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna court martial me for  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands behind his head, Marshall walks in front of Bazylev an MP5 pressed against his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlton pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An air-to-air missile detatches from under the Eagle. Its tail ignites in flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck monitoring the controls. Situation normal. Then al hell breaks loose as an entire wall of instrumentation li up. Warning bells. Flashing lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TACTICAL COUNTERMEASUREs COMPUTER - Springs to life. High-tech readouts, risk analyses, schematics, and  assessments. Radar tracks the incoming, identifies it. On Screen:       "Autopilot disengaged" The plane banks into a dive, throwing Zedeck back against his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs! Gibbs! Get in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen:     "Activating countermeasures"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With no oneat the controls, Air Force One goes into a sha sloping dive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bazylev, thrown off balance, tries to keep his gun traine on Marshall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missile follows a wide arc toward the banking plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs slides into the pilot's seat, attempts to regain  control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans fired at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tactical Countermeasures Computer: "Electronic Jamming has failed Target acquired" Out the cockpit window, the brightly burning tail of the  missile closing on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they fire on us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tactical Countermeasures Computer: "Missile Closing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metallic Chaff Burst Standing by:" The computer counts down from eight... seven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missile screams toward the jumbo jet, a slow easy tar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five... Four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a combat pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three... two....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small bays doors slip open below the aircraft. A cloud of small metallic narticles sprays out of the bottom of the  aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the faces of the terrorists, as the missile comes righ at them. Then the missile veers downward. The Tactical Countermeasures Computer: "Missile Neutralized"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missile dives into the swarm of descending chaff and  DETONATES, lighting up the evening sky. Red flames reflec against the silver-grey clouds.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The shock wave hits the aircraft. Lights flicker and the plane rocks side to side. HOSTAGES are bounced around the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall and Bazylev are slammed against the ceiling and  then the floor. Marshall seizes the moment. Grabs Bazylev's gun. The two  struggle and Bazylez instinctively pulls the trigger. A b of richocheting gunfire sparks across the bulkhead. The turbulence worsens. Bazylev manages to wrest away the rifle, but the plane pulls into a climb, sending Bazylev  tumbling down the gangway into the rear baggage hold. Marshall manages to pull himself up the grating and into galley. He's free, for the moment. INT. AFO, COCKPIT. Gibbs steadies the plane as the shock wave from the explo *        subsides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov examines the Tactical Countermeasures Computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remarkable aircraft. Remarkable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: why did they do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psychology. They're trying to unnerve  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov smiles and puts his hand on Gibbs shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, my friend. Apparently they  cannot harm us. Even if they wanted  to.  rNT. FRONT GALLEY. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall Struggles to assemble the hypodermic and the  container of adrenalin. INT. REAR BAGGAGE HOLD. Bazylev pulls to his feet, heads back down the gangway. INT. FRONT GALLEY. Marshall greets Bazylev with a spray of hot coffee from t Simmering pot as he enters. Bazylev covers up, but the sp sears him pretty bad. He yells in pain, turning. Marshall springs, imbedding the hypodermic needle into  Bazylev's neck. A full dose of adrenalin. Bazylev pulls t empty needle from his neck. Marshall steps back, waiting a reaction. A pregnant pause as they both wait to see what happens. Then Bazylev smiles and slowly turns toward Marshall. Marshall backs away as Bazylev levels his gun. He fires once, hitting Marshall in the arm. Marshall winc off the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgust) The leader of the free world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs Marshall against a wall and holds him in his sig But he doesn't shoot. His breathing becomes faster and fa as the adrenalin takes hold. Building... building... He  screams and clutches at his throat. His eyes spin back and then his heart explodes. Bazylev is caught frozen, suspended in a moment of disbel Death reflex. He fires off several rounds from the gun as collapses. Marshall waits a beat, half-expecting Bazylev to rise. He slowly approaches the body and retrieves the KP5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-lSs pull back into formation around the Jumbo Jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall retrieves the phone, then wedges himself behind waste storage tank, out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Alice On the bunk. Alice's eyes are Watering. Korshunov examines tOPographic maps in the adjacent M1C.c and speaks into a phone in Russian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I was so mean to you  earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose smiles sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, sweetie. I know. (beat) You're being very brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice nods. She's trying. INT. MAIN CABIN. Serge finishes his sweep of the upper level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zedeck) He's not up here. I'm going down  below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall rips his sleeve off, swabs the blood off his arm Bazylev's bullet took out a good chunk of flesh when it g him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they say anything about my family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still alive, but the loyalists  plan to start killing hostages in  forty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell me there's a rescue  operation underway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall opens a travel bottle of Vodka and pours it over the wound. He winces from the pain. V.p CHANDLER                      69. I think we're okay, sir. flow that we know You're alive w can force Petrov to release Stravanavitch. MARSpari Don't tell me you plan to give in to these fucke GENERAL NORmwOOD We plan to do whatever it takes to keep alive, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and if that means negotiating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my policy. We don't negotiate  with terrorists. If we start now,  all of America becomes a target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is different, sir. You're  the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens when Stravanavitch is freed and discover he's got the President? You think for a second that that  crazy bastard is just gonna turn me over? He'll ask for t goddamn moon before he's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Mr. President. You're going  to get yourself killed. Is that your  solution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeing Stravanavitch is gonna get  tens of thousands killed. I can't  live with that. (somewhat resigned) I'm not royalty. I'm an elected  official and the integrity of the  office of the President is infinitely  more important than the man who holds  that office. (beat) We don't negotitate. Not as long as  I'm President. Is that understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silence, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: flow, is there a rescue operation  under way or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee shakes his head at Chandler, signalling "don't tell."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not on a secure line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARSHAlj Whoever said that, shut up. Walter, are you ther

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the cavalry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't do anything until that plane  lands. And when it does land, sir,  it's going to be in hostile *                       territory. To be perfectly honest,  we don't know what the hell to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to take a miracle to figure this one out. A long beat. We hold on Marshall's determined face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serge comes across Bazylev. Checks for any sign of life. Stone cold dead. He looks around and grips his gun a litt tighter as he backs out of the room. INT. MAIN CABIN. Serge closes the stair access panel to the baggage deck. Sealing Marshall off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serge comes trotting up the stairs and collects new clips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bazylev is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov swallows hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapped On the baggage deck. Let me  go finish him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He has the advantage down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me a hostage. A woman. INT. FORWARD BAGGAGE HOLD. Marshall sees that the stairway hatch has been sealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall hits the button for the dumbwaiter. The dumbwait begins to descend then snags on the service cart. Its mot grind to a halt. Marshall slumps dQwn. His hopes dashed. Nothing to do now but wait. INT. MAIN CONFERENCE ROOM. Serge looks over the crowd of hostages like a bouncer at hip dance club. His eyes fall on Maria Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall, seated on the floor. The cabinet next to him is stacked with packs of complimentary cigarettes, all with seal of the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens up a pack and puts the cigarette in his mouth. H snags one of the Presidential lighters, tries to light it several times but it only sparks. XC shakes it. It's out tial. He tosses it aside and reaches for a book of matche but he FREEZES in mid-reach. A thought occurs to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmuring) Out of fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall, lacking a screwdriver, levers open the hatch to the Avionics compartment with the barrel of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: RUT. AVIONICS COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Marshall sees the stacks of panels, piping, Wiring,  electronics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, where are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He searches up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serge leads Maria Mitchell up the stairway. Korshunov nod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Mitchell. Hello again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria is scared, she says nothing. She looks over to the  First Lady and Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov switches on the airplane's P.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *                     Please tell me  your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened) Maria... Maria Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is it you do, Ms. Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria Mitchell's voice echos over throughout Air Force On INT. AVIONICS COMPARTMENT. Marshall halts his search to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm responsible for Press Relations  for the Flight Office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are your fellow hostages feeling,  Ms. Mitchell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared. We're scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose cradles Alice, both of them looking away, as Korshun raises his gun, pointing it at Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why are you scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... because I don't want to  die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hostages, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what am I doing at this very  moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall listens, helpless to do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pointing a gun at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. Thank you, Ms. Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear her? She said I'm pointing a gun at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, to the secret service agent in  the baggage deck. I'm giving you ten  seconds to surrender, or this women  will die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Marshall tries to decide what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs out of the avionics compartment and hurries to front baggage compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck and Serge wait by the stairway hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hostages wait, expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall frozen near the bottom of the steps. To go up wo be to betray everything he believes in, and lose any chan to save the others. But if he stays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears stream down Maria Mitchell's face. She's trying so  hard to be brave in front of Rose and Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Marshall, this is the hardest decision of his life. H face a mask of anguish as he wrestles with his conscience

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts toward the stairs. INT. MISSION COMMUNICATIONS CENTER. Korshunov looking down the barrel of the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes every bit of training and will to stop Marshall  from going up those stairs. He knows what's going to happ He closes his eyes tight as if that will stop it from  happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silent beat. Then... BAAAAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall sinks to to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hostages hold each other tight for comfort. A mournful si fills the room. INT. FRONT BAGGAGE HOLD. Marshall, silhouetted in the half light, craddles his hea head in his hands. The shaft of light disappears as the m cabin hatch closes, sealing him off once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a few minutes to think  about that one and then we'll try  again. Perhaps soon I will choose  somebody important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) She was important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: zedeck and Serge drag the dead woman out of the compartme Alice sobs quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have to be so brutal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Do you enjoy it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I neither enjoy nor dislike. I do  what is necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you? I mean they're people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they are not ny people. You look  at me as if I am a monster, but answer  me this -- when your planes bombed  the oil fields of Iraq, did You cry  for those dark skinned men whose  names you do not know and who's faces  You will never see? Did You cry for  their wives and children. They were  people too, yes... but they were not  your people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is this. (beat) Come now, you're upsetting the little  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman you shot. She was my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way of the world, little  one. Didn't they teach you that in  school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall crosses back to the avionics compartment, talkin on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through static) Chief Mechanic, 87th Air. How can I  help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can talk me through an emergency  fuel dump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Led off to slaughter one at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time I say we rush `em. They can't shoot us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can shoot enough of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't act, they'll kill US all  eventually Who's with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the hostages raise their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief Mechanic has Air Force One schematics open in f of him. He and his staff are huddled around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see the maintenance panel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop it open. There should be a red  switch, toggle it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it's on. We've got some  indicator lights here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're aerated. To dump the  fuel you have to close the circuit  for the pump. There's no switch in  Avionics so you'll have to cross the  wires. There should be five wires,  just to your left. Do you see them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall finds the wires: red, white, blue, green and yel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got `en.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static blankets the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, hang on. Let me double check

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: here, because if you get the wrong ones, you'll cut the e feeds and stall the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The static worsens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First... cut... green wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall, Using a kitchen knife, slices the green wire. H static. The phone beeps... lOsing batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cross it...  The static overwhelms  the voice, then cuts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello? Goddamnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static comes roaring back and garbled voices... MARSHAlj Hello? Are YOU there? Dead. Marshall tries to activate it again. MARSHAIJi Hello? Hello? Nothing. He tosses the dead phone aside. Marshall stares. Cross the green wires with the... what? Red, white, blue... or the yellow. His choice is obvious. cuts the yellow wire and crosses it with the green, leavi the red, white and blue standing. He waits. The engines continue to groan. He allows himsel smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An emergency landing in friendly  territory... there's your goddamn  miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the plane a trickle of gasoline appears and grows into a strong steady stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red warning light flashes on the plane's panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit it. We're losing fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov crosses to the flight deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avionics compartment! It's the only  place. You better get Zedeck down  there fast Unless, of course, you'd  rather be a martyr than a savior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zedeck) Go! Take Serge.. and watch your backs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck nods and dashes out of the cabin. INT. MAIN CABIN. Zedeck pulls open the hatch cover to the forward front st Descends into the dimly lit underneath. Serge descends right behind Zedeck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck, Spooked by the dark shadows, senses he's being  watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's down here. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and do your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck hastens toward the Avionics compartment, gun at th ready. Serge sweeps the area behind. They hear a metallic clank echo and reverberate around hi They both check left... right... behind them... Nothing. It's creepy being a walking target. From behind a water storage tank, Marshall watches down t barrel of his Mp5. With all the equipment in the way, it' almost impossible to line up a clear shot. And they're both well armed. He looks toward the stairway instead. Zedeck enters the Avionics compartment. Serge takes a  defensive position outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The valve is shut. This guy sure  knew what he was doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serge hears a noise and opens tire. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erring on the side of caution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck opens a panel and rips out some wiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to deactivate the by-pass  pump. It'll take a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs checks the fuel gauges. They stop falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've stopped dumping... but we've  only got about twenty minutes of  fuel left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even close. Hell, we can't even  make Syria or Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the Black Sea. I can probably  get us to Turkey or Georgia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! If we land this plane anywhere  else, we will end up another Entebe. (beat) The Americans built a super plane  that flies through mushroom cloud,  evades missiles and... (holding up Maria  Mitchell's press kit) refuels in mid-air. Call the White  House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tactical Map: Air Force One over the Black Sea heading so west toward Turkmenistan. An Aide holds up a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, forgive me for diverting  you from your little wargames, but  I've just added another demand to my  very short list. I assure you it's  quite reasonable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need fuel, gentlemen. And we need  it right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lee whispers to the Vice President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, we can bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure we can strike some sort of  arrangement. Land the plane and we'll  trade you hostages for fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The plane lands when I say, or  it will crash. The hostages are  released when I say, or they will  die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what I want to hear or I  will execute a member of the senior  staff, and will continue killing one  hostage every minute until we crash  or until a refueling plane arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murmuring and hushed discussion floats over the airwaves. A long silence. Korshunov looks toward Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I begin by executing the  President's daughter? She's right  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, you stupid asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be a pity to squander such  a strong personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another several beats of hushed murmuring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER, (V.0. PHONE)
dialogues.text: Fuel's on its way. INT. MAIN CABIN. Serge and Zedeck lower the hatch to the baggage compartme and seal it. They head up the stairs to the M.C.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov paces, weighing his pistol in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We trained for months. Everything  should've gone like clockwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have the hostages, we're getting  more fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's already killed three of us, and  we haven't even seen him. He's also  shown that he can hurt us. I need to  think. (looks at Serge) What the hell are you doing up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back to the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serge takes his position by the conference room. Across from him, against the cabin divider, Marshall peer down the sight of his gun. Serge freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make the same mistake your  friend did earlier... Show me your  hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serge raises his hands. Marshall reaches over and pulls o the clip to his MP5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caldwell, Shepherd and a few other aides hear the key tur in the lock. They quickly take position around the door. Marshall marches Serge in, they're both tackled and smoth by the group. They wrest the guns away and shut the door  quickly behind them. Marshall struggles against his people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me goddamnit. Let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised to hear their boss' voice, the aides and adviso release Marshall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, how the hell did you  get on board?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never left. Where's my wife and  daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took `em out. They're probably  on the upper deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, Major Caldwell here  has a plan to get these hostages of  f the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dumped most of the fuel. They'll  land soon and Delta will take its  shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A refueling plane is already on it's  way so we won't be landing until we  reach Turkmenistan. Your best course  of action is to release me. I will  be merciful.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL 84.
dialogues.text: Sir, maybe we can use this. Turn it to our advantage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Caidwell, the ground's a few  miles away. How do you propose getting  us from here to there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satellite pictures of various landing strips projected on wall-sized monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the three dozen airports in  Turkmenistan, only five have  sufficient runways for a 747. Of  those five, only these three have  shown any activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Northvood points with a laser pointer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this one here, see this. It's a  satellite dish and it wasn't there  two weeks ago. Basic communications  uplink, which suggests extensive  communicatins ability. I'd say this  was the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you confident you can take the  facility?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's night there for a few more hours.  That's a real plus. But I won't lie.  As far as special ops go, this one's  a bear, but I think we squeeze it  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get it going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Press Secretary's about to go  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can get to a lower altitude,  we can use parachutes, but at this  altitude, we'll pass out from Oxygen  deprivation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already played our cards, Major.  There's no turning back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't jump from here or at this  speed. But if we could get a message  out - tell the refueling plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've cut communication, and I  spent a good bit of time looking for  alternatives. My only solution ran  out of batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nearby SECRETARY in her late 20's pipes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fax machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fax machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissive) No good. I said they disabled the  communications system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I thought about this, Mr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President. Voice lines and faxes are on two completely  different systems of encryption. It'd be easy to overlook the data systems. What do they have to lose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Caldwell) Get `em ready. (to secretary) You... come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen thousand feet, sir. And two  hundred knots... otherwise it's  suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caidwell, holding Serge's gun, takes position by the fron stairway and waves the other hostages on. They emerge fro the conference room, and move to the stairway. Marshall and the secretary rush the opposite direction to the equipment room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid shouting questions, the PRESS SECRETARY alights to t podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Quiet please... First let  me... Please... I have a prepared  statement... The White House confirms  that the President's aircraft, Air  Force One, has been hijacked and is  currently controlled by foreign  nationals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murmurs, shouts, and more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the President onboard?/ What about  the First Family?/ What are their  demands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... please... For security  reasons I can not comment on any  specifics except to say that the  Vice-President is doing everything  within her power to resolve the  situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.V. monitor on broadcasting CNN.  We're in the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov turns toward the monitor. Furrows his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are almost out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the President? INT. EQUIPMENT ROOM. Marshall and the Secretary step over Perkins' body on the way to the fax machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall grabs a piece of paper and a pen. Scribbles a no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we sending it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White House Situation room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signs the paper and hands it toher. She slides it into the machine, checks the listed numbers and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone should give you a raise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, sir, you could be that  someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wait... will it work? A few beats, a few beats more. The machine pulls the paper in and begins scanning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall's note spits out of one of the fax machines. But the bevy of activity, will it be noticed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caldwell spins open the rear emergency pressure door and  leads the hostages into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cargo hold extending up the tapered edge of the aircraf rear. The hostages begin pulling parachute packs out of t overhead storage bins. Helping each other. INT. MISSION COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEM. Korshunov listens to Zedeck yell into the phone in Russia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no movement on Stravanavitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov eyes Alice and Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor will there be. My husband does  not negotiate with terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be the first to pay for  that mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caidwell assists everyone in strapping on their packs. He addresses one group, mostly women and senior staff, who b into the larger chutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These chutes are designed for a safe  slow descent. They'll deploy off the  line automatically as you step from  the plane. (turns to another  group, mostly younger  men) You guys'll have to pull your own  rip cords. Wait until you're clear  from the plane, but not any longer. (he checks packs and  straps) Once I check you, go stand behind  the yellow line. You're good. You're  good. You're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two neat lines ready to jump. One line on the deployment  wire, and the other set for freefall. Marshall and the secretary arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. president?  pwtsHALL The fax  went through. We can only wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your chute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll not going without my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caidwell crosses to prep the Launch Ramp controls. INT. COCKPIT. The gas gauges read very close to empty. Korshunov Stands behind Gibbs, while Zedeck keeps an eye on the First Lady

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that goddamn plane?  tNT.  EMERGENCY PARACHUTE LAUNCH RAMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody waits. Caidwell watches the indicator. 30,000 f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KC-135, the USAF flying gas station, descends in front Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One, this is AF-135-RA. We  have been instructed to refuel your  plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About goddamn time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please change course to Zero Seven  Four and drop to eighteen thousand  feet. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One, acknowledged.  tNT.  EMERGENCY PARACHUTE LAUNCH RAMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The altimeter begins to fall. A wave of relief washes ove the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KC-135 extends its flying gas pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One, please reduce speed  to 250 knots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger.
Okay1 now   KC-135 PILOT (V.0. Radio) vent your fueling  system. It's the yellow lever on the upper control panel. And nex to that there's a toggle Switch to open your intake. Got

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger KC-135 PILOT (V.0. Radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One, do you see the fueling arm? Through the cockpit Window, the long metallic appendage  dangles ahead of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ga get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Air Force One edges its nose up to the appendage. The  appendage finds it's grove and slides right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, eighteen thousand feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall indicates the four men without parachutes on. TW AIR FORCE CREW MEMBERS, Major Caldwell and Shepherd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we stay with the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That isn't necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of them changes his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silent beat. A few forced smiles in this very tense roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax everybody. I used to do this  for a living9 Caidwell pulls a switch  on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depressurizing compartment. This `11  take a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President crosses to one of his aides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, by the way... who won the Duke  game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out for yourself, sir. I'll  have it waiting at the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KC-135 flies above Air Force One, connected by a gaso umbilical cord. INT. EMERGENCY RAMP PLATFORM. Caldwell breaks safety glass. Reaches into a compartment pulls a lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mechanical him and clank gives way to a rush of wind as the tail section of Air Force One hinges open on hydrauli struts, extending like a plank behind the plane. We can s the sky with its angry clouds. Rushing by at two hundred knots. INT. FLIGHT DECK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warning light flashes on the control panel. Tactical Vi Display shows the emergency parachute ramp activating. INT. MAIN CABIN. Zedeck runs toward the conference room. He bursts through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking: Zedeck Sprinting to the rear of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tail cone section of Air Force One hinges open and  parachutes begin to blossum from the rear of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From several miles back Carlton watches the chutes emerge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio traffic echos through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got... okay... so far ten chutes  deploying of f the line. Dropping  signal flares for search and rescue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck reaches the emergency pressure door. Through the  porthole he sees the hostages getting away. He tries the  door hatch. Locked. Zedeck looks around. Crosses to the lower rear galley. He kicks open the panel on the stove. Rips out the propan tank. He runs back and wedges the tank into the door lock He backs off 50 feet, turns and opens fire on the tank. The tank explodes, blowing the door out.

dialogues.speaker: EMERGENCY PARACHUTE LAUNCH PLATFORM
dialogues.text: The pressure door blows open and an explosion of pressuri air blasts through the platform. The remaining parachutists are blown out the rear. Chutes deploying. Marshall and Serge are knocked down the ramp, tumbling to oblivion. Just as Marshall's about to slide off the corne of the ramp he grabs its hydraulic strut. Plummeting death. His grip is all that separates his dangling body from a l Serge tumbles by Marshall, limbs flailing, and with a scr Woven from a thousand nightma5, he loses his grip and sli off the ramp into the jetblack sky, falling endlessly. Shepherd and Caldwell manage to hang to safety webbing as the wind whips around them. The two other air force crew memb Without chutes also manage to hang on. As the plane depressurizes, it BUCKS like a wild bronco. Marshall looks down into the sky. Below his dangling legs parachutes blossoij. He's straining... he can't hold on  forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs fights the wheel. Oxygen masks spring out from an overhead compartment as a is sucked out of the cockpit... The plane shudders and jumps badly....

dialogues.speaker: KC-135 PILOT, (V.0. RADIO)
dialogues.text: Air Force One, back off. I repeat, back off. Gibbs wrestles with the yoke, to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's bucking. I can't hold her!

dialogues.speaker: KC-135 PILOT, (V.0. RADIO)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Back off! Back off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One jerks upward, snapping off the fueling arm the KC-135.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOK OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The broken edge of the fueling arm scrapes along the top Air Force One... metal against metal... tearing a gash in the plane... Sparks fly.

dialogues.speaker: ONE OF THE SPARKS
dialogues.text: ignites the river of gasoline being pumped from the refue craft's belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs Sees the fueling arm catch fire. It doesn't take a  rocket scientist to figure what's coming. The flames cree up toward the gas tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Shiti Gibbs pushes the stick  down and Air Force One begins to  dive to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One descends. Whipping fire trails the KC-135. Slowly rolls it way into the plane's main tank. A burning fuse. BARRROOOOOOOM! A FIRECLOUD ERUPTS ACROSS THE SKY. Sky like daylight. From this incredible firecloud, the burned out skeleton o an airplane emerges, falling toward earth. The F-15 escort zoom toward the unexpected fireball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody break. Now! Now! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlton's planes go into emergency climb, standing on the afterburners to escape the inferno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall hangs on to the strut for dear life as the  pressurized air swooshes by him, taking with it everythin that isn't nailed down including some of the spare parach Fire rains down from the heavens, the sky like one giant  napalm nightmare. The shock wave hits the plane, slamming it violently. Almost yanking the hyraulic arm from Marshall's grasp. The military aides without parachutes lose their footing tumble off the platform. SCREAMING as they fall into fire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The burning KC-135 shell, an apocalyptic Flying Dutchman a vengeful Kamikazee dive at Air Force One. It's gonna be close. The flaming shell passes only a few hundred yards to the  rear of the 747.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall's got a great view. Flames dance in his eyes as watches the refueling plane descend. The brightness subsides, and the sky grows dark again. The wave of pressurized air subsides leaving Zedeck, Mars Shepherd and Caldwell on the ramp. Caldwell begins edging toward Marshall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me save him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall barely hangs on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man, he is the president, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck motions to Caidwell with his gun. "Go get him." Caldwell crawls down the ramp and extends his hand to  Marshall.

dialogues.speaker: THE PRESSURE DOOR SLAMMING SHUT -
dialogues.text: zedeck leads Marshall, shepherd and Caldwell away.

dialogues.speaker: IPRR. AFO'S FLIGHT DECK -
dialogues.text: Gibbs steadies the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs checks the guages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than enough to get us home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun begins to set along the Potomac in long streaks o red and pink. The White House lights flicker on uminating the long staunch columns, the pillars of democracy.

dialogues.speaker: RNT. WHITE HOUSE SITUATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Tired. Strung out. Bickering within the small workgroups. Chandler crosses to General Northwood, who has just hung the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They still have the President, it's  past their deadline and they haven't  called. What do you think it means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like any good poker player, they're  checking over their hand seeing which  cards to play and which to discard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck leads the three hostage into the M.C.C. Rose and Marshall - their eyes meet. Enormous relief for both of them. Marshall smiles at his wife, as she fights  back her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Korshunov) He didn't leave us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a resilient man, Mr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President. Zedeck grabs Caldwell's hands and tapes them behind his b with duct tape. Rose and Alice already have their hands t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must forgive the tape, but we  were starting to feel outnumbered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs puts the plane on automatic pilot. Rises to join th group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov separates Marshall from his family. Waves him i the Com Officer's chair. His hands are now wrapped too. Gibbs enters looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Agent Gibbs. You helped do  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it is my duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're duty to what? The country you  served doesn't exist anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My loyalty was never to my country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I serve my commanding officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think the leaders of the  KGB would allow peristroika to ruin  years of infiltration? No, when the  Soviet Union collapsed, we took our  sleepers with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov holds up a telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now since we've had very little luck  getting Washington or Moscow to  cooperate, I wondered if you would  be so kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over my dead body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But since I only have a few of  your staff left to kill, perhaps I  will start with your family instead...  Gibbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs grabs Alice and shoves her into a chair. She fights him off, and he smacks her across the face and shoves his gun into her neck. Marshall and Rose struggle against their bonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world is such a dangerous place  and we can't always protect our  children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. You can kill me but leave my  daughter alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov runs his finger down Alice's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She isn't a part of this. This is  between you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call up Petrov and order  Stravanavitch' S release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall looks to Alice, then Rose, then back to Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This administration does not negotiate  with terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity. Mr. Gibbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs withdraws his pistol. Places it against Alice's tem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps a President does not  negotiate, but does a father? (beat) An interesting choice. Your daughter  versus your world vision. The implicit  trust of a family against your oath  of office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears of fears are streaming down Alice's face. She looks into her father's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once the trigger is pulled, she  is gone forever. Then, I wonder, how  do you live, knowing you could've  saved her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall struggles with his duty. His honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And could you ever forget the look  on her face as she ceases to exist...  Late at night, when you think about  her, will Stravanavitch really matter  anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall tries to look away, but Zedeck forces him to wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy. Daddy, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim... for godsake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look inside your heart. No one will  think you weak. Five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice's face, trying to be brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice looks at her father for the very last time. Then sh her eyes tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs begins to squeeze the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'll do it. (broken) Just leave my family alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbs withdraws the gun from Alice's temple. Alice opens eyes and gasps for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are true to your nature, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday, you'll regret my nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like seeing people get  hurt. Now in morality, that is a  virtue. In politics, however, that  is weakness. (beat) You were a hostage to everyone else  *                    long before you  were a hostage to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleepless Petrov paces back and forth, smoking a cigare The phone RINGS. He looks up expectantly as his aide answ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the President of the United  States wishes to speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petrov stops in mid-pace. Considers his cigarette for a m and then walks over to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guard walks down the cold steel hallway. He rattles the bar of a darkened cage, he pulls out a set of keys and un the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stravanavitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stravanavitch awakes, and leans forward into the light. H and the guard trade looks. After a beat, the guard turns retreats down the the hallway. Stravanavitch rises from his bunk and approaches the cell door. He leans against it and it swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stares at Marshall. Her look is hard to read. Distan cold, perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can my husband sit next to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov considers the pair. Hands taped behind their ba They're harmless. Korshunov nods. Marshall rises and joins her on the pilot's rest bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why you stayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... don't start with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose moves closer to him, and speaks in a low voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I need to tell  you... and God knows if I'll ever  get another chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind, we see her push his taped hands away. He looks at her quizically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter what happens, you have  been and always will be my hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels the wall behind him. A dull edge of metal twiste slightly from the earlier cockpit door explosion. He understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have always been my guardian  angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never regret my life with  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Marshall's back, he begins to cut away at the duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivan Stravanavitch walks down the long prison hallway. Ot PRISONERS see him and begin banging on their bars in rhyt As he parades down the corridor, the banging grows until becomes deafening. Stravanavitch smiles a cocky smile. One by one, guard doors swing open in front of him. In fa a few of the HACKS salute Stravanavitch as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The communication board beeps and Zedeck picks up the lin He exchanges some words with the caller in Russian, then  hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's confirmed. Stravanavitch is on  his way out. Our men are waiting  outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov smiles and puts his hand on Zedeck's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got what you wanted. You going  to release us now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very valuable. And our nation  needs so many things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall leans his head against the wall. Just as he expe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I... Could I have some water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov nods, motions Zedeck to take care of it. Zedeck reluctanty descends to the main cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taste of defeat is bitter, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing I've learned as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President... all defeats are temporary and all victories temporary. Today' 5 conquerers are tomorrow's vanquished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: e                    Very poetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zedeck arrives with a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's one thing I've learned  from being a sports fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
