dialogues.text: Zedeck brings the cup of water to Marshall's lips. Marsha tips his head back to receive it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water spills over Marshall's face. He shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't over, til it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With blinding speed, Marshall leaps to his feet and swing his arm around Zedeck's throat. He snaps Zedeck's neck wi quiet efficency. Gibbs fires at Marshall, but Marshall, using Zedeck as a  shield, grabs hold of the terrorist'sMP5 and lets loose.. mowing down the former Secret Service agent. The rest of Gibb's shots pelt against the cockpit control sending showers of sparks flying. Korshunov whips out his gun and lines up a clean shot at  Marshall's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov fires at Marshall, but... Major Caidwell dives in front of the bullet spray taking rounds in his chest. Marshall turns his aim to Korshunov... but Korshunov grab Alice and presses his pistol to her head. Stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be hasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall holds Korshunov in his sights. Slowly advancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love your daughter, Mr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President. And I love my country. It's a fair trade. Korshunov backs away to the steps. Marshall does not lowe his gun. Korshunov disappears down the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd stands. Marshall unwraps Shepherd's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Petrov... (to Rose) I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall slowly descends the steps to the main cabin. As  soon as Shepherd gets her hands loose, Rose rushes to  Caidwell's aid. Shepherd crosses to the communications pa and picks up a headset. Begins dialing numbers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his nightdress, Stoli Petrov nurses a vodka on ice. Hi PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petrov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petrov's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall of bars part and Stravanavitch walks through. Into the main exercise yard. The main gate separates him from... A group of men wait in the street by a limousine. The main gate opens slowly. When the men sees Stravanavitch they come to attention an salute him. Stravanavitch returns the salute. And then st his march toward his limousine...

dialogues.speaker: PRISON.
dialogues.text: The front gate begins to close. Worry crosses Stravanavit face. His men rush toward him, take position by the gate. Stravanavitch breaks into a run toward his limousine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt! Halt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stravanvitch looks behind him. Guards rushing toward him  from the yard... the limousine fifty yards ahead of him.. closing fast... On the limo... the back door open and waiting. A shot rings out from the guard tower, followed by anothe and another. Like popcorn starting to pop. Stravanavitch' men return fire. A minor war breaks out. Loyal guards bat Stravanavitch sympathizers. Stravanavitch caught in the middle, hit by one bullet, th another, then another. He makesit to the open rear door o the limousine, but collapses dead. Everyone stops firing. Stravanavitch's men rush to his si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petrov slips under the covers as an aide knocks on his do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about Stravanvaitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead, sir. Shot while trying to  escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be it. The world will sleep easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Petrov turns out his bedside light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall ascends down from the upper deck. Spots Korshuno by the front stairway. Korshunov pushes Alice down the st to the underdeck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Autopilot engaged. A shower of sparks erupts from one of bulletholes in the panel. Directional compass... the course heading drifts off to t south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squadron of F-15 still surround Air Force One, which  slowly banks to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've changed their bearing. (into headset) Air Force One. Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over... Air Force One please respond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, this new bearing. We're headed  for Iraq, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unaware of the course drift, Shepherd and Rose lift Caldw onto a bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Major. Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caidwell smiles, settles peacefully back in the cot. He d Rose reaches up and shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall makes his way through the dimness. Stepping  cautiously. A shot rings out and richochets off a piece of piping rig over Marshall's head. Undaunted Marshall advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Korshunov. You won. Now  let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens, footsteps ahead of him. ON Korshunov - holding Alice by her hair, practically dra her over the mid-section wing cross-braces. As Marshall appears in the gangway he fires off another s hitting a cooling vent. Steam fills the' gangway area, ba in red auxiliary lighting. Korshunov retreats toward the rear of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nowhere to go.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: A cacophony of Arabic. The radar indicates an apparent  invasion force heading for its borders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iraqi pilots rush to their MiGs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on the tactical display... Air Force One's cours has arced south and the plane is heading straight for Ira

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They aren't answering their hails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How close are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENERAL NORTHiqOOD Fifteen miles, so two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Iraqi Ambassador won't take our  calls. We're trying to get through  to their Central Command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To tell them what? The great infidel  himself is flying overhead, Go get  him? This is a man they burn in effigy  daily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If challenged, our fighters are to  state that they are on a rescue  mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iraqi's won't buy it. Either they're  already in on this or they'll think  we're spying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If fired upon, tell our fighters  that they are ordered to engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall checks behind the racks of stored goods and lugg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: open. A finger on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, look out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov fires and Marshall dives out of the way. He con up in defensive crouch ready to shoot, but all he can see Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been better, Dad... You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall smiles briefly. But Alice is yanked around the  corner. Marshall hears foatsteps. He junps to his feet an cautiously follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the tactical display as a second group of fighters app ready to challenge the F-l5's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One and the cluster of F-15's zoom by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force one... please respond. Air  Force One, you are entering hostile  air space. Air Force one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Carlton receives is static. INT. AFO'S COCKPIT. Nobody at the wheel. The automatic pilot is still engaged INT. F-15 EAGLE COCKPIT. Con. CARLTON Okay, guys, time to earn your paychecks. Sta in protective formation, and do not engage, I repeat, do engage... unless you are fired upon. All wings acknowledg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halo one, acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halo two, acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the pilots chime in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall swings into the cubicle... empty. He crosses to the cargo bay/parachute launch ramp hatchwa Looks through the porthole. Korshunov straps on one of the few remaining parachutes. tosses the rest of the spares out onto the platform. Marshall steps onto the platform. Korshunov fires off a r forcing him behind the door for cover. Korshunov pulls Alice in front of him and yanks down the  ramp activation lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ramp lowers, and Alice gets her first look at the dro Marshall watches the remaining parachutes slide off the r and into the stormy sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes your ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let my daughter go or I'll take you  out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you put down the gun, I promise  not to drop her on the way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov backs toward the edge of the ramp, pulling a  struggling and fighting Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go now! Or I will kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korshunov is a foot away from the edge of the ramp... two steps back, he and Alice will take the plunge. Marshall lines up his shot. Korshunov laughs as he presse his pistol to Alice's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you won't. You'll compromise...   like always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall fires, his bullet ripping apart a good deal of  Korshunov's face and snapping his body back. Korshunov tumbles off the platform, but his limbs are cau in Alice's. She's knocked to her belly and his dead weigh drags her off the edge of the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall dives down the sloping platform, reaching out fo her... Alice tries to grip the platform with her hands, but she  can't hold on. Her hand slip off the metallic lip. But as she falls, she's caught by the wrist. Strong arms  pull her up. Her father's arms. He carries her back to th safety of the plane. She's sobs uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh NY god... oh my god... oh my god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, honey. I got you. I got  you. You're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd and Rose appear. Marshall locks eyes with Rose.. smiles. Shepherd crosses to the parachute bins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone. They're all gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane shakes with the thunder of a supersonic boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half dozen MiGs race by the cluster of American aircraf at breakneck speeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENERAL CERALLOS eyes the radar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans say they are escorting  a damaged plane. Our pilots confirm  they are surrounding a 747.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we warn them off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They refused to alter course  and the 747 would not answer our  hails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cerallos takes a moment, looking at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some kind of trick... a  preliminary airstrike in response to  our troop movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are in our airspace. We would  be within our rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world would not look on us kindly  if we shot down a civilian airliner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soldier listens to chatter coning over his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot says it is does not have  the markings of a commercial jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warn then again. If they don't  respond... shoot them down. We will  not be intimidated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another sonic boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall makes his way to the cockpit. Through the cockpit window, a MiG accelerates out of the  darkness coming straight at us. At the last second it pul up slightly, riding over the top of the 747. Its sonic boom rocks the jumbo jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god. I think that was a MiG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MiG? Where the hell are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall rushes back to one of the rear upper deck window He looks out at the F-l5s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're flying a protection formation. (beat) Call D.C. Find out what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your last warning. You are  violating our airspace. Leave  immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said back off and hold your fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are on a rescue mission. Do not engage. I repeat, do n engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MiG loops into position behind Carlton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: switches his targeting computer on. Finds carlton in his  sights. Good tone. The pilot pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missile detaches from the MiG and slides toward Carlt Carlton breaks formation, leading the missile astray. His plane tucks into a tight little roll. The missile misses  over Carlton's rolling wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halo Team, this is group leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halo Team is cleared to engage. I repeat, you are cleared engage. Carlton pulls his plane into a monster climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the real thing boys. Let's  fly and fry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ringing phone is answered by an aide. A few beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Chief of Staff calling...   from Air Force One. They've retaken  control of the aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell him to get the fuck out of  Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall settles into the pilot's chair. Shepherd comes i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iraq, sir. We're over Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iraq? Shep, you're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall looks at the plane's bearing. The instruments ar shot to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long's it been since you flew,  sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An F-15 follows a MiG into a barrel roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MIG pilot targets Air Force One. He cuts his speed as lines up his shot. Gets a lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arabic/subtitle) I have radar lock on the 747.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On tactical computer -   "RADAR LOCK" "Dis-Engaging Auto-pilot"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane banks left into a dive. Marshall grabs the yoke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finger on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's evading. Can I take the shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking forward from underneath an F-15, the MiG heads to Air Force One. The F-15 fires a sidewinder. On the MIG... as it fires its missile. The F-15's sidewin blows the MIG up, taking the missile with it. Air Force One is clear... for the time being.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHALL STRUGGLES TO REGAIN CONTROL OF THE 747. HE OVER-
dialogues.text: compensates and the plane rocks side-to-side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't even driven a car since  you took office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall checks out the tactical display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it's like riding a bicycle...  downhill with no brakes and somebody  shooting at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall finds the throttle, pushes it up all the way. He feels the plane out, gently nudges it into a turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two MiGs flare out of an engagement with the F-15's and b toward Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got two on the loose. Someone get  on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halo Two... I can't get there in  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two MiGs lock onto Air Force One. Each fires a missil at the President's plane, before breaking in opposite  directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red buzz. It's all Marshall can do to keep the plane fl straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got two coming at us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tactical Countermeasures Computer... as it tracks the  incomings... "Heat Seekers" "Launching Flares"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brightly burning flares launch from either side of Air Fo One's wings and descend toward earth. The missiles follow the heat of the flares, plummeting  harmlessly to earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shock waves from a nearby MiG explosion shakes the pl In the aftermath, Marshall takes a moment and pulls on th pilot's headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.S. Pilots, this is Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy Air Force One. Welcome to the  party.

dialogues.speaker: FIGHTER PILOT
dialogues.text: I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you... can you drop in front of  me? I'll follow you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang tough, I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the two MiG's heading for Air Force One. An F-15 drops in behind them. The MiGs scissor and break OPPosite directions. The F-l5 can only follow one of them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tight on one, the other's loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need help down here. The other MiG comes up on the 747 and opens fire with his CANNONS. The shells rip up the surface of the aircraft's  wing. The MiG swoops past Air Force One and jerks into a vertical. On the damaged wing - Fuel starts leaking out and the out jet engine catches fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red warning light flashes on the control panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hit. We've got an engine on  fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it down. Shut it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall reaches over and toggles the shutoff switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine whirs to a halt and the rushing wind blows out the fire. But now she's only got three engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the cockpit window, an F-15 settles in front of A Force One... Flames pouring out of its tail. Under any ot condition, it would be pretty. Alice, Rose and Shepherd w Marshall fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is President Marshall. I know  you guys are busy, but we need some  help here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canton in pursuit of a Mis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, it's an honor. Now  with your permission can we lead you  the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your pilot on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's busy being dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlton breaks left, lines up a MiG and fires. He nails t Iraqi aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's flying the fucking plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing what I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you, can you change your heading  to Zero Four One point six?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. We've lost navagition. I  don't know where that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzzer sounds in Carlton's cockpit. He's been locked on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Hang on. Somebody help me  out. I got one up my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlton puts his plane into a triple canopy roll then sla on his airbreaks. The MiS shoots by him and Carlton lets  loose with his CANNONS. The MiG pulls up and disengages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and three are heading toward the  Boeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We're gonna arc a fat one to  the right. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canton's plane edges around to the right... and Marshall  follows. The 747 leans at an angle and continues the turn until the F-15 is dead ahead. Another plane explodes ahea of him at three o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we doing, Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still got three MiGs running around  and six more on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you fly any faster?

dialogues.speaker: IRA'. WHITE HOUSE SITUATION ROOM
dialogues.text: All eyes are glued to the tactical screen, showing the  dogfight. They listen to the radio traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at full throttle.

dialogues.speaker: FIGHTER PILOT
dialogues.text: Air Force One, MiGs four and five are on your tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well get `em off me, goddamnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two MiGs targeting the big bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get a lock. Break right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall struggles with his stick turning the aircraft to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course its pointless. The Boeing is a fucking sloth  compared to these fighters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The familiar buzz. Tactical computer. "RADAR LOCK" Alice notices the computer. At the upper right hand of th screen, the computer displays Defensive Mode/Offensive Mo Defensive Mode is highlighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, look. It says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice reaches out and touches the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, pumpkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice's touch activates offensive mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along the belly of the aircraft, two hatches pivot open,  revealing a series of missiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get good tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The F-15 fires, but the Sidewinder screams past the turni HiGs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tactical computer... Over graph display. "Offensive Counter Measures Activatedw "Launching Missile

dialogues.speaker: ERR. AIR FORCE ONE -
dialogues.text: The Flying White House launches two sparrow missiles. The MiGs release flares, but the Sparrows don't flinch. Twin FIREBALLS erupt in the sky as the Mics evaporate. But from the fireball, a MISSILE emerges coming right at Force One. Closing fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, they got one off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the console... sparks fly. Tactical computer flashes... "SYSTEM FAILURE" "Missile Locked"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARSHMj What did you touch? What did you touch!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall checks display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. It's got us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missile has Air Force One dead to rights, crawling ri up its tail pipe. Just before its about to hit the plane...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YAAAAAAAAH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An F-15 swoops up from below. Like a Secret Service agent during an assassination attempt... The F-15 takes the bullet in its mid-section. BOOM! The blast slams bits of the fighter plane against Air For One. Rocking it badly. Chunks of the plane rip away metal sheeting on the 747's wings and tail section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got six more bogeys, closing fast  from the south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squadron of Navy F-14s drops into the theatre. The cava

dialogues.speaker: NAVY SQUADRON LEADER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You Air Force boys get that plane out of here. We'll take care of those MiGs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that. Kick ass, Navy.

dialogues.speaker: NAVY SQUADRON LEADER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That's affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall works the controls of the 747. Tries to engage t automatic pilot. The system is fried. Marshall wrestles w the yoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, we got a problem here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stay on my wing, sir. I'll take  you all the way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We're losing fuel and my rudder's  not responding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canton pulls up and drops back over the plane. He looks d at the Boeing's wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, man. You're torn up pretty bad  out here, sir. Do you have any  elevater control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sluggish... I think it's jammed too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Tower, we got a problem up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I got some bad news. Air Force One... there's no way they can bring it down. Plane's damaged, it's unlandable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall looks out the side cockpit window, sees Carlton' 15 fly steady with his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlton salutes Marshall. Marshall returns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for your help, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Northwood collapses into his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got no chutes. They can't  control the plane, their engines are  failing and they're losing fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefered the terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's game, set, and match. There's  nothing to do, except call the Chief  Justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief Justice? What on earth  for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To swear you in as President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead silence in the room. General Greely ambles over to the tactical map and just s at it. He loosens his tie and scratches his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your strike team, General?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On their way back to Turkey. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just had the craziest idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KC-lO Transport plane. KC-lO PILOT Romeo Tango Zulu. We copy. Change of Orders  acknowledged. We are en route. The KC-lO banks into a turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, Rose and Shepherd stand behind the pilot's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into header) Is it our only option? - Then do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall looks to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're now over the Black Sea, so  even if they could get us chutes  we'd drown or die of hypothermia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: before they could get to us. We've got one other option  though...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard news shot. CNN REPORTER facing the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: incredible, yet unconfirmed reports,  of White House staff members  parachuting from the plane while the  President himself battled these  terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family gathers around their T.V. set to hear the report

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet now, in a bizarre twist of events,  CNN has learned that Air Force One  has been severly crippled and is  virtually unlandable and our sources  report that the First Family is  trapped onboard.  A daring mid-air  rescue operation is said to be  underway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long's it been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty five minutes. They should be  here any moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They better. Fuel's almost gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, navagation lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm slowing us down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd crosses to the forward cabin door. He follows  directions for emergency door release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emergency door opens and the emergency raft/slide dep It inflates before being ripped from the aircraft, gently wafting through stormy clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air rushes past the airplane at two hundred miles an hour

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT'S OPEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO YOU SEE TEEM?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAN YOU SEE THEM?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd looks out into the night sky. Inky blackness and greying clouds. The horizon, though, lightens as dawn  approaches. Shepherd spots navigational lights descending from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HERE THEY COME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's side cargo door is wide open. Army Rangers begin win out three-inch wide cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KC-lO pratically on top of Air Force One. Separated b forty feet. Super flying. The cable slaps against the side of Air Force One and dra along it's edge. As it slides past the open doorway, Shep grabs it and hauls it into the plane until he has its end He hooks the cable to a metal clasp at the top of the doo frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE'RE HOOKED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hooked. Hove into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo Tango Zulu, acknowledged. We  are assuming position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red light flashes on the control panel. Engine number t grinds to a halt. The pressure guages drop to zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get going. We don't have much time  left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose bends down and kisses Marshall on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. I just wanted you to  know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall holds her with his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too. (beat) We're going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice throws her arms around her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My school play's Tuesday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guages show fuel is low on the remaining turbofans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transport plane dips into a lateral position. The two planes are connected by a hundred yards of cable. FIVE ARMY RANGERS in snatch harnesses slide down the cabl bridge onto Air Force Onefr As they hit the open doorway, they unclip and sail into the main cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you folks out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electronics department. Banks of television sets. Shopper watch intently. The audio broadcast plays over a map of t region and a graphic of Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tower, Air Force One has been boarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo Tango Zulu, copy One the  television, graphics of the First  Family against the Presidential Seal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're listening to an intercepted  audio feed of radio communications  between Air Force One and Army Special  Forces, flying side-by-side,  attempting to get the first family  off the damaged aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Army Rangers harness themselves `to the survivors. to Alice, one to Rose and one to Shepherd. The other two  head for the cockpit. Alice and her Ranger are ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on tight. The first step's a  bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice takes a deep breath, closes her eyes... The soldier clips on the cable, and shoves off the lip of the doorway, SAILING DOWN THE WIRE. They plummet, Alice screaming. The line goes taut. The pair slide the hundred yards to the KC-lO. Rangers gr them and bring them into the transport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoppers listen to television sets, galvanized. KC-lO PILOT The first daughter is on-board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Army Rangers approach the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Army Ranger #2 slides into the co-pilot's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it, sir. You get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose clips on to a Ranger's harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clip on the wire, move to the lip, and rappel off th side of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the first Ranger leads Marshall through the M.C.C. WHEN A SHOT RINGS OUT... The soldier at the flight yoke slumps over dead. Marshall and the first Ranger swing around to see... A bloody but smiling Gibbs, lying on the deck, clutching MP5. The Ranger draws his weapon... But Gibbs swings his rifle around. Pulls the trigger. BAM BAM. BAM. Hitting the Ranger. The Ranger returns fire, shooting round after round at Gi before pitching over, dead. Gibbs draws a bead on the President, smiles... but he doe have any strength left to pull the trigger. He expires. And the plane begins to dive. Marshall runs for the cockp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and her Ranger are pulled aboard the transport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd and his Ranger clip onto the wire, but the KC-lO now higher than Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Marshall back at the yoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air Force One, you're losing altitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hold it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KC-lO transport dips lower and lower, trying to maint its position under the descending plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tower, Romeo Tango Zulu. The First  Lady is onboard. Air Force One,  status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost two of your men. There's  no one to fly the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can send another one over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time. I only have one engine left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the KC-lO back in the Position, Shepherd and his Ran shove off the dying plane toward safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief of Staff is onboard. We  are at six thousand feet descending  rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's biting their nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stabilize it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we're going to pound pavement  in less than three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall holds the yoke in one hand and unclips the snatc harness from the dead ranger in the co-pilot's seat. The last red light on the engine control panel starts to  flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'M LOSING NUMBER FOUR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall, still fighting the yoke, stands. He takes a dee breatn, drops the wheel and runs like a motherfucker for stairs. EXT. SICY,  AIR FORCE ONE. Drops into a banking twist. The cable line runs taut. The KC-lO tries to compensate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall dives down the stairs from  the upper deck, comes up sprinting  for the door.

dialogues.speaker: TNT. AIR FORCE ONE, COCKPIT -
dialogues.text: Engine four fails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's out of control. I can't pace  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taut straining cable snaps one corner of the metal cl The clasp starts to bend.

dialogues.speaker: IN SLOW MOTION -
dialogues.text: MARSHALL sprinting to the open door. The clasp twisting. The cable hook ready to slip of f it. Marshall clips on, and dives out of the door. He slides f feet down, when.... The clasp gives. The cable line snaps away from the plane one end connected to the KC-l0, the other connected to... Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall slides down the cable, gripping at it, trying to break his fall. Air Force One plummets toward the water. Marshall sliding, right behind it, running out of cable. At the end of his rope, literally. Marshall's harness sna on the end clasp. He hangs on for dear life. Moments later Air Force One impacts. A huge EXPLOSION, water and flames blows sky high into th night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tower. Air Force One is down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead silence as all the patrons stare up at the T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I repeat, Air Force One is down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo Tango Zulu. Do you have the  President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo Tango Zulu, please respond. Do  you have the President? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no response...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive fireball and glowing remains of the President aircraft almost reaches up to where the President struggl to hold on to the end of the cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winch it up! Winch it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall slipping off the line, unable to get a solid hol His hands slick with blood. The belly of the KC-lO gets closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Ten mare seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his eyes. His fingers begin to give.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All over America, families, gathered around their televis wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo Tango Zulu, do you have the  President? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo Tango Zulu1 this is Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please report. over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat of silence, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo Tango Zulu, do you copy? Do  you have the President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We copy. Stand by... (beat) Tower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tower, here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Romeo Tango Zulu changing  call signs. (beat) Tower, alert air traffic, Romeo Tango  Zulu is now Air Force One. (beat) This is Air Force One... The President  is safe onboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy, Air Force One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers flood the situation room. Cheers flood the Department Store. Cheers flood the press room, the living room, the sports  bars, churches, schools, construction sites, hospitals... all across America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall huddles tight with Rose and Alice as a MEDIC att to their wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall turns to see this soldier, a fresh-faced, 19-yea old kid, saluting his Commander-in-chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome aboard, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marshall returns the salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KC-1O soars into the emerging sunrise, flying in the  center of the remaining F-l5 formation.
